I am from Seoul and Beijing, but I am currently working as a developer through various challenges. When I was a second year of undergraduate school, I translated for overseas exhibitions at an ICT company called OOO. At that time, I became interested in the field of ICT and started the challenge by taking a major in the IT department within the school. In order to make these challenges an opportunity, I prepared for all of my majors during the vacation, and gained confidence by getting close to perfect scores in most IT majors. After that, I left school and challenged myself. First, I worked for a year as an intern in the data department of OOOOOO, a clothing brand located in the U.S. As I was working on data management and research, I became interested in the data field, so I returned to Korea and looked for big data development work. Thanks to my hard work in programming during my undergraduate years, I joined the internship in the SW development department of OOOOOO, which is in charge of OOOO's digital solutions business, last October. It took a lot of challenges to start this unfamiliar path of ICT and to do development work. I have the courage to take on the challenge and the ability to bring those challenges to achievement. There were two projects that I remember the most about collaboration, "True Meaning of Collaboration." They were all in the same problem situation, but I was able to learn true collaboration with different responses. The first was the TCP/IP socket game programming project in the advanced programming class. This project was memorable as a case of failure. Despite being a programming class, it was a problem that all the team members didn't know how to code. The team members who couldn't code couldn't do anything because implementation was more important than strategy planning, and it was a tough situation because their teamwork score accounted for 30 percent in the project evaluation. In the end, I made all the projects by myself, and I couldn't produce the best results. The second is the HSI and RGB color model conversion project in the digital media class. For this project, we first had to understand the formula for converting HSI and RGB, and then we had to express it visually and finally we had three tasks to create code. This project also had a variety of team members, and most of them were not able to code. However, we tried to find what we were good at and collaborate as much as possible based on our previous experience of failure. A classmate who was good at math solved a formula and taught it, a classmate who was an art student expressed a color model in three dimensions, and finally, I worked on a program by solving the formula that I learned from my team member in three dimensions. I learned a lot from the fact that these students who are specialized in different fields can meet and produce results with a single goal. I was able to learn that collaboration is not just about dividing work and division of labor, but about working together in a single direction while taking charge of areas where we can do well with each other."," [Understanding and Experience with Mobile Services] - For the job of developing and operating an application, it will first be necessary to understand the relationship between mobile services and users. Since my undergraduate years, I have been interested in UX and have taken related majors. In particular, I was able to increase my understanding of the user experience by experiencing a project to improve the service usage experience of Naver and KakaoTalk in the mobile service design class. Based on this, I participated in OOOO's Retail Shop Event App Project while working for OOOO. As an indoor location service app using beacon, I was in charge of managing beacon in this project and linking beacon to Android using OOOO's CMS. Through this, I was able to experience that large projects were systematically operated according to Agile methodology. I also learned that it is important to build and manage log data well for better service. [Practical English Competency] - I think English competency will be important as we have various overseas branches. I usually studied English steadily to develop my major, and as a result, I was able to get opportunities such as interpreting at overseas exhibitions and working at the headquarters in the United States. Through these experiences, I was able to develop my practical English skills. We can use this to communicate for better service operation and development.""Creating a business that reflects users' future demand through technology" First of all, I think that "SMART" is not just about sticking to the performance of technology in solutions, but about developing and operating that is more optimized for "people." In addition, I think "CREATIVE" is to predict users' future demand to create optimized services and implement services by obtaining new business insights through them. The current ICT industry is changing rapidly, and I think the trend of that change is "people." It is no longer a trend for people to learn skills, but to think and predict people, not technology. In this regard, I think Hanwha S&C's vision slogan is the best slogan to respond to the changing trends in the ICT industry. Since October last year, I have participated in a big data research project at Funta to present the business direction. In this project, I collected 9.5 million SNS data related to K-pop and developed code to find the meaning in the data by utilizing open sources such as NLP (Natural Language Processing) and machine learning. Through this experience, I learned that the big data field can contribute to the creation of new services that reflect trends, and I was able to develop my relevant capabilities. Based on this, I want to become a solution expert who reads the hearts of customers of Hanwha S&C."???,,,

"Individual development is the development of a company." I have seen a documentary about eBay Korea's Hackathon. Through this, I felt the development culture of eBay Korea and the passion of the members for development, and decided that I must join the company. I am a person who grows up on my own with pleasure always in mind. For example, I have built up my development capabilities by challenging internships and development clubs with the goal of becoming a Back-End developer. In addition, I worked on my own projects to solve the inconveniences around me. For example, I developed a department bulletin board notification system and a self-introduction letter management system. As such, I would like to take the initiative in learning and grow as a developer in five or 10 years. In this respect, eBay Korea decided to apply because it has a culture where developers can grow. I think Hackathon is a great culture where individual capabilities actively contribute to the growth of the company. This is because I can give pleasure and meaning to my employees and make them have a sense of ownership in that I contribute directly. Therefore, I think that my professional values to work, always thinking that it is my job, can be harmonized well on eBay. "I will become an S/W developer who can contribute to eBay through leading growth." "Web Programming" It is a subject that made me aim to become a back-end developer. It was interesting to interact with the database inside the web application, design the business logic, and write the code that provides direct service. I studied Servlet/JSP by myself, and furthermore, I was equipped with the ability to build API servers using Spring Boot. In addition, I was in charge of back-end development in development clubs and interns, and I often used Ajax and JavaScript. Based on this, I will contribute to eBay Korea's back-end development. "Data Structure" It was interesting to solve the structure of data and while implementing it. Furthermore, it was a subject that gave me an opportunity to come across what is called problem solving programming. While interacting with this subject, I learned algorithms such as full exploration, DP, and alignment. I attended the class by creating my own library through the process of getting to the core of the problem and generalizing it. Also, it was interesting to learn different ways of thinking by looking at other people's codes. Even after joining the company, I will continue to learn algorithms so that data structure and algorithm knowledge can be used for actual work.""Department bulletin board"Department bulletin board is not RSS supported, so I could not receive notifications when a new article was posted. To solve this inconvenience, I carried out my own personal project. It periodically crawls the bulletin board based on Quartz scheduling, and performs data comparison based on the key of the MAP to search for a new article. If you find a new article, it consists of the process of sending FCM to users who want to be notified of it. This project is developing with me. When I first started this project, I used Socket. However, I learned JSP/Servlet, Spring Boot, and ORM through personal learning, internship, and development club activities, applied them to the project, and performed refactoring. Even after joining the company, I will not only use my knowledge or work, but also apply it to personal projects to improve my development skills. In addition, if there are any inconveniences in the way we work, we will become a developer who can solve them with software. "Tag-based Image Search" "I have experience participating in OOO and developing a "Clothes Search" that can find clothes for specific shopping malls as images. I used Microsoft's Custom Vision Service API. The "Clothes Search" searches for images using the data learned based on tags. For example, if you upload a related image with TAG {One Piece, Check}, the image for the TAG has been learned. Here, when a user uploads a specific image, the system analyzes it and informs the similarity for each TAG in numbers, and outputs and shows images in the system with tags higher than 90%. If the above technology is used in eBay Korea, it will be able to lead E-Commerce in its clothing field. The first reason is the rise of user experience. Unstructured thoughts are difficult to search because they are difficult to express in keywords. If a user can search for clothes with images, it can be a service that can satisfy usability and usefulness. The second reason is to gain customers in the apparel sector. Unique and innovative services will be an opportunity for customers to use eBay Korea."???,,,

My strength is that I am meticulous, meticulous, and I want to finish something perfectly when I do it. Sometimes, I like to follow the standard of practice enough to be told by my colleagues that I feel frustrated because I don't know the ropes well. Because of this personality, I am studying not only the previous questions by memorizing them, but also by reading the basic books, understanding the theories accurately, and moving on, and then by reviewing the contents through the previous questions, I think I was able to achieve good results in the academic exam or the certificate exam. My weakness is an obsession caused by pursuing perfection. I get more stress than others because I think I am in serious trouble if I don't meet the daily tasks or quotas because I set a goal of doing something until the end of the day and try to keep it. In order to overcome these shortcomings, I thought I would need to accumulate knowledge that could be helpful in performing tasks. That is why I am studying for an information security industry driver certificate to gain extensive and in-depth knowledge about security. I am also trying to think positively and try to be less stressed. Before that, if I was discouraged by the thought of 'Why can't I do it?' Now I think I will study more if I want to do this assignment. Even if it takes a while, I won't give up, so I will be able to do it.' I think the biggest achievement I made during my school year was in credit management. With my interest in security, I went to the Department of Security, but my first class was mainly focused on basic subjects such as English, mathematics, and science. After the first semester of the first year, I started taking programming classes related to my major for the first time in the second semester, and I performed the task of making a maze game until the end, showing my standard of penetration, and I got good grades. Since then, the fun of learning about the major has led me to follow the department class passionately, and my grades have been on the rise. As a result, the grades, which were only 3.5 in the first semester of the first year, were raised to 4.4 in the second semester of the second year, when the students began to take the security-intensive major. In the process, major classes were never present by proxy or absent, and I think it was important to try to communicate with my assistant or professor and solve problems that I did not know. I had a perception that the most important part was to build up my major knowledge that I thought was basic. So I was able to keep it for four years without giving up or neglecting it after working hard for a few semesters, and I can be proud that the constant effort is an outstanding achievement.""I worked on a project to model the IP traceback technique in a class called Big Data Application Security. The project was divided into four areas: Python, Hadoop, R, and Arena, and I was responsible for analyzing the correlation between IP header fields using R. The team formation was done randomly, but compared to other teams, the atmosphere at the beginning of our team was not passionate and individualistic play was strong. During the team meeting, we did not proactively present ideas or report detailed progress on the role, and we did not get any answers when we asked questions or opinions on the group chat room. At first, I planned to follow the lead if anyone had a friend, but I was embarrassed by the passive atmosphere. After doing my part to encourage the active participation of the team members, I organized the ip traceback technique and informed the team members of the initial Arena sample model formed by another team member to tell them what was wrong. I also read the materials to be presented by other team members in advance and advised them on what to fix. As a result, the team members began to exchange opinions on the final outcome one by one, and shared their roles. As a result, I was able to get good grades in the team project and received compliments indirectly from other team members. At first, I was worried that the result of the project would be disgraceful compared to other teams, so I was able to lead the team and act as a mood maker for the first time in a project that I spent time on, and it was an experience where I felt proud through the changing atmosphere and progress of the team." Since I was young, I have enjoyed playing RPG games, and my experiences of being hacked into my account at the time have led me to dream about becoming a security expert. After that, I went to a related department, and through my studies, I gained basic knowledge about it and security, and obtained the information processing industry engineer and information processing engineer certificates in order. After that, I participated in a two-month internship at a network security solution company to experience what I was doing at a real security company. I was interested in system security by participating in writing various vulnerability help, writing buffer overflow exploit reports, and writing articles on the latest security trends, and recently I prepared for an information security technician exam. As I was preparing for the exam, I became interested in monitoring the system through the security log and responding to violations, so I wanted to work for a general company rather than a security company. The decisive reason for applying for Webzen was that it was something I wanted to do normally after seeing an open recruitment announcement. In addition, if I work for a game company where young and passionate people gather in security, I think I will be able to come up with ideas to respond to new situations every day, and I will be able to breathe and enjoy myself in a free atmosphere." "I feel responsible for my duties and plans once, and I make sure to communicate clearly so that there is no misunderstanding in the communication process, and I try to make sure to know what I don't know for sure.During the winter vacation of the second semester of my second year, I slept less every day to achieve my goal and studied on my schedule, so I raised my TOEIC score by about 150 points in one month. When I started studying for a certificate, I was meticulous enough to read and read theoretical books two or three times to build up my foundation step by step, despite the reviews that I would pass if I solved the previous questions. Because of this personality, I don't like to go wrong or not finish my job, so I have taken on the job as much as I can and achieved good results. In addition, since I am not quick-witted in the communication process, I tend to ask questions and organize my thoughts and knowledge in order to understand the intention I want to convey at once. I participated in a firmware reverting study in my department's lab. At that time, it was a method of verbally conveying the progress of the study, but I wrote and presented what I had studied in the first hour in a good way that it looked good, and as a result, it was improved by generating presentation materials every week with good responses from study participants.",,,,

I became interested in security experts after I had several experiences of being hacked into game IDs and large portal sites that I enjoyed for neglecting account management in high school. After that, as I entered the security-related department, I was assigned to investigate security accidents, and I learned that there were many security accidents that started with the carelessness of the manager or neglected vulnerabilities. After that, I thought that applying the security theories obtained in the department class to real situations and checking for vulnerabilities fit well with my meticulous and principled personality, so I wanted to do something to manage the security system. KT recently had security accidents related to personal information leakage in 2012, 2014, and 2016, and I applied because I wanted to unfold my dreams and passion in the process of experiencing these accidents and growing into a stronger and safer company. Recently, I heard an article that concerns about security damage are circulating with the start of the Fourth Revolution. After joining the company, I want to aim to strengthen the security of products related to the iot service and AI industry. KT's latest artificial intelligence service called Giga Genie examines security issues that may arise from the introduction of speaker recognition technology, and in the long run, I would like to contribute to becoming a company with the image of 'Reliable KT' by applying a vulnerability check list that can be applied to other industrial products in the future. "The challenge that I persevered with the most was to raise my language score. My first TOEIC score was about 560. The reason I studied TOEIC was to meet the lowest score to get a scholarship at school, and I had to score over 750 to be recognized until I graduated. I quit my private academy to start studying, but I applied without knowing it, and I ended up taking classes with students in the range of 700 points. At first, I couldn't attend the high-level classes and homework, so I couldn't even participate in the remaining studies and did homework at home. I couldn't meet my friends for the first month and slept for five to six hours a day because I had to do new homework every day and I had to do it on weekends. As a result of constantly making study plans and living according to the schedule, I was able to achieve much higher score than I wanted in two months because I was afraid that I would want to go off the mark for a day. Through this experience, I was able to break the stereotype that I have no connection with English, and I realized that no test can pass if I try hard. In addition, I don't think that getting a high score is just a story of others, but I have also become a habit of setting goals step by step and periodically checking progress to improve myself." Last semester, I worked on a team project called Big Data Application Security to analyze big data attack logs and create simulations on how to detect ip spoofing. The project was conducted in a way that a group of four divided Python, R, Hadoop, and Arena into individual parts, and I was in charge of analyzing the correlation between the ip header fields extracted from a large number of logs using R. The goal was to acquire various tools through cooperation, but the initial team members did not pay attention to the other team members' parts, thinking, "I need to do well in my part." However, in the atmosphere of the group Kakaotalk Room where my friend in charge of Arena's part, who has not made progress for several weeks and no one is interested in it, I cycled the interim simulation made by the team member and gave feedback to activate the group Kakaotalk Room. Later, when the team member said to me, "You seem to be the hardest working member among the team members," I felt proud, and the final presentation of our team was also well received. Through this experience, I learned that even if all the team members are passive, I can get a positive response by showing passion for even the smallest thing that I can help others." "The core competency I think is the ability to grasp the core when having work-related conversations with practitioners. First of all, in order to grasp the core, one must have basic knowledge as well as related terms as one's own. I was told by the professor who took the CISO position while taking the mobile swsecurity class last year, "I am in the IT security department in actual work, but I can't talk because I don't know the basic terms." And while working as an intern, I started studying for certificates on the advice of the head of the headquarters. I obtained the information processing technician license this year and am currently studying the information security technician license. It was good to be able to organize security terms that I learned for nearly four years while studying handwriting, and I am preparing for practical tests by running the security tools in the book and learning how to use each option. In addition, after two months of internship experience at a security company, I learned that I need to know rapidly changing security trends and new attack techniques to operate the system in response to them. I usually look at websites such as Security News, Daily Securities, and Anlab's latest security news to focus on the recent security accident news and new vulnerability analysis. This is helpful for obtaining certification in the short term, but in the long run, it is like having a meeting with team members or studying in advance what to do when operating other companies' security equipment in the event of a security accident, and I think it can be a small experience."

"My growth plate remains open." I grew up thinking of 'growing' as the most important value of my life. What I'm referring to as 'growth' is the constant pursuit of new things. I've always loved solving math problems since I was young. But after solving a problem, even if the answer was correct, my method of solving and the method of solving the answer sheet were always different. It was interesting to me that one problem has many solutions. So it has become a habit to learn new solutions, make them my own, and think about whether there is another solution in various ways. I don't think this is limited to math problems. If you approach an issue in the same way, you can lose ways of thinking in various ways, which is an obstacle to your growth. So I don't settle down to the old way, but always pursue new things and make progress. And 'growth' is about listening to other people's voices at the same time as constantly pursuing new things. When there is a problem, no matter how many ways you think alone, there are limits and sometimes it is hard to get out of bigotry. I don't hesitate to accept and adopt other people's opinions. You may think that this blurs your subjectivity, but I don't think so at all. Rather, I think that through other people's thoughts, you can discover your shortcomings and improve them so that you can have a clearer subjectivity. I am also confident that this nourishes your growth, and furthermore, it will help your team grow. I think this tendency is also consistent with the vision that LINE pursues. "I think LINE and I will be partners who can create the best synergy effect." "There is no game that you can't make with passion." During this summer vacation, I created a mobile game while working in a joint development club called OOOOOO. Our team of three developers and two designers created a game called "OOOOOOO Galaxy." You can earn coins through three mini-games and purchase new fidget spinners with the coins. As a developer, I made one mini-game, and I participated in some of the store system and game balancing. The development tools used Unity2D and C# scripts. In this game, I used NGUI, Unity's representative and powerful UI system, and an asset called LeanTween, which can effectively animate. Implementing the game UI and animation has little to do with the game's core logic, but it takes a lot of time to implement it properly. However, I used the aforementioned assets to effectively reduce the time, and was able to focus more on implementing the core logic of the game. Meanwhile, one of the developers went out for personal reasons. And I took over the part that the person who left was developing. At first, I thought it would be easy to continue making it because it was already made to some extent, but it was a big mistake. The style of coding with me is completely different, and most of all, there was no annotation, so it was very difficult to understand the code. So, I tried to code in my own style from the beginning, but only refer to the existing code for parts that were difficult to implement. It was a long process. But I couldn't delay time because I had work that I'd done before, and I didn't mind staying up all night. As a result, I was able to catch up to what I had done before in two days. And in my mini-game, certain objects had to be created and destroyed more than 10 times per second. But in the process, there was a lot of throughput, which caused the game to stutter. So I solved it by creating objects only at the beginning of the scene, and reusing them all. There were many other difficulties, but I also referenced the Scripting API on the official Unity website and solved them through active communication among team members. As a result, I completed the game within a period of time and was selected as an excellent work by the club. It has now been uploaded to the Google Play Store. My experience like this will be very helpful for me to work at LINE.",""Game Developer, who truly loves games." My experience of passion and dedication was working on the game development team at OOO, a university game club. After I was discharged from the military, there was a period of skepticism and lethargy about my department. At a time when I wasn't sure what to do, I joined a game club just because I liked games. And there I met some game-loving classmates. I had a lot of fun. All the club activities were playing games together and talking about games, but I was amazed at how lively I was. So I thought, "Let's do something by combining it with what I like, not just feel skeptical about academic work." After that, people who were interested in game development gathered in the club and formed a game development team. It was the beginning of my game development career. The initial game development team of 7-8 people started by conducting game-related seminars every week. I prepared and participated in seminars on various topics related to development, further developing my passion for game development. That was only a year ago. Over time, the scale of the game development team grew, and last winter vacation, we divided into three teams and produced games for each team (see portfolio). However, our team was at a loss because everything was our first time. So we got together every day to discuss countermeasures, and I studied about the Unity engine. I learned much faster than I did before when I was learning my major at school. I knew that at this point.That programming is not about studying "to become a programmer" but "because I have something to make." And despite having to do everything from learning necessary knowledge to producing for two months, I was able to launch a game that I had planned. I think I can do anything with my love and passion for these games. Although I'm not sure I'm better than any other developer when it comes to development expertise. But I have more pure passion than anyone else. It started with my passion and need, and in a short period of time, I created something from nothing. I'm all set to play a role as a game developer at LINE,,,

"We Make a Trend" The start-up club "TrenData," which was founded to create a new trend with a convergent mind, conducted weekly trend seminars and found start-up ideas. The weekly trend was an activity to research, present, and discuss trends in ICT technology and market issues and changes. In addition, based on the trend presented by students from various departments, we tried to analyze market problems and present a new paradigm to the market with a start-up mind. Through trend presentation and idea discovery activities conducted for more than a year, I was able to quickly learn the changing trend of the ICT market. In addition, all club members presented and created new ideas together, rather than devising ideas with their own thoughts through discussion and ID discovery activities based on the published data. Based on these club activities, it was an opportunity to challenge the start-up of a business under the theme of Some: See O2O service by converging ICT technology and culture and arts with the award of four contests, and creating a new market by utilizing public data.""" -Overview The public data analysis and visualization platform based on big data, also known as GView, which won the Excellence Award in July 2014, is a platform that enhances convenience so that not only experts but also the general public can find and visualize the value of data among countless public data. -Proposed Background In line with the opening of public data, which is the core strategy of the government 3.0, GView proposed to develop a big data analysis/visualization platform to create a platform that can analyze big data that was not easily accessible. In the existing market, when analysis data was needed, big data analysis companies and data scientists mainly analyzed the data needed. However, this idea was proposed to break the existing market framework and come up with a way to easily analyze data even for ordinary people who do not have expertise." "This idea focused on two keywords: analysis and visualization. The core elements of data analysis technology are Hadoop and Hadoop Echo systems that can handle large amounts of data. These technologies have grown and developed rapidly with the advent of big data. The technology of the big data industry is continuously growing as it is used by world-famous companies such as Google and FaceBook. At the same time as saying, "The era of big data has arrived," many companies are doing many businesses using big data, and the economic profit generation is also increasing every year. The idea was to process a large amount of unstructured data that had not been processed so far by using Hadoop, which is the core of these big data analysis technologies. In addition, in the field of visualization, 'how to show the data' to the user was selected as an important keyword. To make it easier for customers to understand the analyzed data, the data visualization tools such as Weka, R, and SPSS were used to communicate information effectively using charts and various visualization means. Through this plan, we wanted to provide an opportunity for users to analyze the research activity index they want with simple data input and gain new insights within it."???,,,

"Would you like to collaborate with KT and my passion?" The motivation for applying for this job is in line with my interests. Currently, KT is starting a new trend by introducing the artificial intelligence TV GiGA Genie. I think this is a huge advantage. Most household appliances in Korea are TVs. Therefore, it is possible to use multiple IoT services efficiently by using AI TVs with high accessibility. In addition, after participating in the Seoul Motor Show in March, we linked GiGA Genie to the car and demonstrated vehicle control through AI-based voice recognition such as remote start-up and location guidance. As such, KT is changing our daily lives with rapid momentum through the AI field. I was also interested in AI field and gained experience and knowledge in it through my studies and projects. So I applied because I thought it was more suitable than anyone else for this job. And I thought that KT's best-skilled employees will be the support group for the development of professionals, so I thought I could realize my vision and grow together. After joining KT, I will first develop basic job competencies and become GIGA-level newcomers in the SW development profession. After joining the company, I will build up my expertise in deep learning by building solid basic knowledge for five years. I will develop the ability to quickly solve any problems by running around and studying or attending conferences by building deep knowledge. In 10 years, I will create various ideas and skills that KT's services can connect with people anywhere.""Learn responsibility and cooperation"Team project leaders need to be responsible and cooperative. I learned that when I joined an academic club at a university. I gathered with my friends who had a lot of things to learn, studied, and helped them to know each other, thereby building knowledge. I went to a household appliance contest to broaden my horizons. I aimed to make laundry management APP with NFC function according to my team members and the theme. So, I made it possible for users to check the laundry guidelines with the Yahoo weather API. And accordingly, I could set the laundry timer. As I was working on the project, I planned the schedule as the leader and coordinated with the team members. However, in the previous experience, there was a short production period and a problem of having to create ideas and functions for the school project. So, we divided the roles based on the areas that the team members were good at and revised and supplemented the schedule to resolve any problems. As a result, the project received favorable reviews. So, I was able to intern for three months and learned a lot of experience. After that, I took the position of the head of the school in the club, and I was able to win the Best Team in SW activities as I continued to work with the project. Through this experience, I gained a sense of responsibility while being a leader, and I understood that teamwork toward goals is important in the project. With this sense of responsibility and the spirit of collaboration with the team members, I will make a service for everyone at KT.",""Energy Hackathon: Learn Passion" I went out to the hackathon and showed my passion without giving up even when I encountered time limits. Through the energy Hackathon, I was able to check the electricity usage at home in advance with a smartphone, so that I could create an energy-saving APP that could plan the use of electricity. However, since a lot of technology has already been developed, people around us gave negative opinions. So we thought differently and thought about whether it was convenient to use from a user perspective, even though it was already made. Young people usually use smart devices well, but my grandmother and grandfather thought of what they still have difficulty with and what the blind are uncomfortable with. So, for the elderly and the visually impaired who cannot use electronic devices well, we decided to add an ARS function to implement a function that can inform them of the gold used by voice according to the power they currently use. I made the Android part and let the team members use each API to make it. We divided the roles and proceeded according to the limited time. As a result, more than half of smartphone users in their 30s and 60s were evaluated to be able to easily understand how much they consumed in terms of money through the service, prevent indiscriminate power consumption, and prevent loss of money for individual families, and received the Energy Hackathon. So, I learned that the results of development after thinking about the customers' minds can be more efficient. In the future, I will join KT with a village for users and try to complete it without giving up despite many difficulties. In order to produce the "Challenge Spirit and Machine Learning" project, it is necessary to make efforts to find and study new technologies in person. Such thoughts are due to the experience I gained while conducting a contest with my friend in college. For the contest, I aimed to produce a program that made it easy to recognize, store, and modify the score. So, I wanted to give convenience to those who use guitar through the program. To this end, I worked hard on planning and production for 3 months with my friend, but I couldn't get a prize in the end. The reason is that the guitar codes in the sheet music in the image have a low recognition rate. This is because the sheet music image lacks recognition depending on the slope or shadow. Through this, I felt that machine learning was necessary, and I learned other codes by using open source tessellation ocr. After learning about each guitar code, the recognition rate definitely increased. Through these efforts, I tried to improve the project and challenged the contest again. As a result, I was awarded the best team in the OOSW contest and experienced firsthand whether many people were interested in machine learning along with the new knowledge of machine learning. With this opportunity, I studied AI on my own and held a seminar in front of more than 20 students on the subject I studied. It was a special experience to solve problems by studying and using new technologies that I only saw as news articles.Through this active thought and continuous skill acquisition, we will change the world with KT.",,,,

[Write it big] I chose Samsung Electronics to go to the place called 'Dream' because the first thing that people in many countries think of is 'Samsung' when they think of Korea. Many young overseas students still carry cell phones with Samsung logo on them. When I saw Samsung on the donation list of the British Museum during my trip to Europe, I felt that it was Samsung that made many activities and donations from all over the world. As such, I wanted to join Samsung and make many innovative products to publicize the country and entertain many people. Also, working for Samsung, a place with the world's best technology and value that contributes to Korea's many developments, is helpful for national development and overcoming the crisis. The name 'OO' means that I will use it big, not replace it. Just like the name, I will become a master of IoT in 10 years. Just as Samsung developed ARTIK for IoT, in 10 years, we will provide convenience and pleasure to all products as well as autonomous cars, smart watches, and smart homes can be connected to customers. I believe that the greatest reward of developers is to make customers happy with the results they have made. After joining the company, Samsung Electronics will make everyone in the world edgy..."[Living the same way as yesterday and expecting a different future is like getting sick] Einstein said. In other words, whatever you aim for, you should not lose your passion and work hard. My goal is to make products for everyone in the world. I had this goal when I joined Samsung Software Membership at the recommendation of my seniors in college. As my seniors recommended, I was able to gather with friends who had a lot to learn from, study hard, and help each other gain a broader perspective and knowledge. One of the most memorable things in my membership was the Samsung project conducted by the home appliance business department. To make washing machines in the home more efficiently, I want to create an app for NFC function and a prototype that efficiently provides users with a laundry guide and notification system for current weather. I felt a sense of responsibility for the work as I worked with the idea of making products for actual customers, from project proposals to prototype programs. Afterwards, I felt like I wanted to make products convenient for people, and I promised to study for a lot of my major knowledge. Samsung also aims to provide a 'better world' to its customers. I want to join Samsung, which has the same goal and dreams of the future as me, and grow into a programmer who will change the world. So, I have continued to develop my two strengths to provide products to customers with stable and high satisfaction. First, I have a lot of experience in IT-related activities. I participated in various internship programs and hackathon related to IT to achieve the grand prize by showing my creativity. In addition, I was awarded the certificate as an outstanding team for Samsung S/W activities by demonstrating my leadership as the head of an academic club, and gained an excellent IT knowledge in an academic competition on campus. Through this, I learned the importance of passion for my goals and was not afraid of failure. These experiences can create rapid organizational convergence and synergy after joining the company. Second, strong DB knowledge. Data base is an important technology that goes into every program. This is because we need to build a DB to have information even if it is a small program and use it again. I felt that this DB was important, so I studied and acquired the OCP certificate. And based on this, I created a POS system using Oracle. While studying in the DB lab, I studied how to develop it to become a safe program. While producing this program, I became more confident about DB production. This IT knowledge will help to increase the safety of production programs. With this potential, we are trying to become a talented person who can present our vision to the company in the future. We will continue to cultivate these strengths to become one that changes the world at Samsung.","[Unmanned cars and deep learning] Currently, many companies around the world are interested in autonomous cars and are investing in development. Tesla CEO Elon Must said that he would complete the preparation for commercialization of autonomous cars in September 2018. And Google, Toyota, and Hyundai cars are also investing a lot in developing these technologies. Watching these news, I was curious and interested in how such technologies could be made, and while studying artificial intelligence myself, I learned how to solve problems with the power of collective intelligence with a lot of information. And in Hong Kong, it was found that by dividing the subway maintenance time into a timetable through deep learning, the work efficiency was increased by 30%. And Google or YouTube extracts feature points with each image and video and creates the information that the user wants again. And Facebook automatically finds and creates relational data that allows you to find facial features and create names or know your relationships with others when you upload a picture. I think this development of deep learning will lead to another IT innovation. Already, Korea has the world's best Internet and smartphone penetration rate, but the platform to lead the market has not been completed. If the platform is established, I believe that building the ecosystem of the Internet of Things will eliminate the limited types of products and their range of use. In addition, deep learning technology will be absolutely necessary to provide services to products. This is because the amount of information we can have will gradually increase in the future.Through this, I think it will be common to collect information with big data, process it with deep learning, and then help people through the Internet of Things (IoT). More broadly, I think businesses can be created and jobs can be created in many new fields.",,,,

"Change the world through music." I think songs are a big part of people's lifestyle. I am constantly interested in music such as Superstar K, Produce 101, and The Masked Singer. Such interest is spreading Korea around the world through K-pop. Bugs provides the largest sound source in Korea through various platforms in high quality. Therefore, I think working at Bugs Music, the best of music services, is a development and rewarding job in Korea. I am trying to change the world with IT with the idea of SMART and CREATIVE to join Bugs. While working as an intern, I built a web service that records and manages personalized services as My To Do. Although there are many TODO services, many people currently create a lot of things to do through job studies, but we tried to solve the inconvenience of not sharing their schedules due to spatial constraints by creating a TODO list. And I started with the mindset of actually producing using everything I learned. I started production using Spring Boot, and DB used MySQL. And I applied Nested Results for Collection with the Mapper from MyBatis. And I used Jenkins for CI to make continuous management easier. And I wrote a cleaner code using coding conversion, and I made UnitTest test the code for the service sector. And I tried to make the service sector more secure by using transactions. Unlike students, in practice, a project is not one alone, but several people. So I think we need someone who has experience in CI and thinks about algorithms and safe codes. Even if I join Bugs in the future, I will be an applicant who writes while thinking about even one line of code.""Ui/UX, RADSONE" The reason I think so is that when the phone was a 2G phone, and when the computer was before Windows XP, they all used letters and keyboards like Lizz. However, the concept of a mouse was created, and you can intuitively see it by clicking and dragging. This was not just a UI/UX conversion, but an increase in usability and increased intuition. As such, I use my iPhone during the Bugs service, and unlike other services, if I press the category button, I can see it in a checkerboard format right away. So I think the good thing about Bugs is that it is easy to find other functions while using it. Another good thing about Bugs is its RADSONE technology. Anyone who finds and listens to music will want to hear it more vividly with a better sound. Also, there are times when you want to listen to a specific instrument better, or you want to pay the most attention to the vocals. Bugs provides a total of four sound modes and has the largest FLAC sound source in Korea. Therefore, I think the service that shows superior strength in sound quality is better than anywhere else. "In the case of Bugs service, it is not distinguished by LTE/WIFI, but by setting it as streaming, there is an inconvenience that the sound quality must be continuously changed depending on the communication environment. " If you don't think too much about sound quality, you can set it to the AAC+ low-capacity format. I think this is a disadvantage in the WIFI environment because when you want to listen to high-quality music, you have to change the music format every time the communication network changes. However, there is a music storage function as a countermeasure. If you have enough storage space, you can download music to your device and play music without using data. However, I think this is a disadvantage because this alternative method is difficult because the capacity is small when using a 16G iPhone like me."- TODO Personalization Service 1) duration: 2016.12 ~ 2017.02 2) Key details: Establishment of a web service that records and manages personalization service 'My Halil.' 3) What I contributed: Development of servers based on Spring Framework 4) Skill or Knowledge: Spring Boot, MySQL, MyBatis, JSP, Jackie, J Unit, Jenkins 5) Result/Performance: Development process experience, production of Java-based web environment. - 2016 Energy Hackathon 1) Progress period: 2016.02) Main contents: Producing an energy-saving APP that can be used by checking electricity usage in advance 3) Contributing points: APP Developing an APP or Knowledge: Google TTS, Newtone API, EnerTalk API, Android, JAVA 5) Results/Performance: Grand Prize Winner - 15 years (prize) OO Development Capability Evaluation 1) Progressive contents: 2015.08.25 2) Main contents: Algorithm solution 3) Self-contributing points during software membership activities: Skills or knowledge: BFS, DFS, data structure, C, JAVA 5) Results/Performance: Acquiring intermediate (AM) grade - Participating in app production and research of OO Electronics' home appliance business (Smart Washer APP) 1) Progressive contents: Participating in the production of APP by OO Electronics' home appliance business in the first half of 2015 - Participating in the production of APP by OO Electronics' home appliance business in the first half of 2015 3) Contributing points: Producing washing machine information and data usage applications using NFC. 4) Skill or knowledge used: Android application production, DB connection, and weather API were used. 5) Results/achievements: favorable reviews during the internship process, experience in the development process, experience in implementing various Android functions - Other learning APP development through score recognition 1) Progress period: 2014.05~2014.082 Main content: When a user takes a picture of the desired score through video processing or selects it from the album, the appropriate guitar code is automatically generated, the accompaniment is played according to the code, and you can check how to pronounce the code. 3) What I contributed to: Making the Android part. Each note was displayed on the screen to know how to pronounce, and a function to modify, change, and delete the code was added. 4) Skill or knowledge used: Android midi, Android SDK, Android NDK, JAVA 5) Result/Performance: OOS/W Best Teamwork Award,"

"Important Value I Learned in a Hard Time" When I just entered middle school, my family was very difficult due to the bankruptcy of my father's company. My parents were busy, and my sister was a high school student, so it was just my brother and I until 10 o'clock. Even though I was young, I thought that there was no one to protect my house except me, so I came back home right after school. I naturally learned responsibility and understanding by eating with my younger brother and sharing cleaning. Thanks to this, I was able to build a smooth teamwork by sometimes taking on the role of a responsible leader and sometimes a strong colleague during the project. "How to succeed through challenge" My biggest strength is the courage to challenge. When I was in high school, I was afraid to stand in front of people due to trauma. Rather, I thought that if I stand in front of more people, I will be able to overcome my fear, so I applied for the National Singing Contest. As a result, I failed, but I was not as afraid of standing in front of people as I used to be. After that, I learned how to succeed by challenging and failing whenever my fear was ahead of me. When it comes to network operation, I will become a talented person who leads innovation through various attempts. "Checklist for meticulousness" On the other hand, the downside is that I lack meticulousness in handling tasks. During my internship, I made a mistake of misspelling documents. Reflecting on my inability to check thoroughly, I made a list that I must check when writing documents. Afterwards, I got into the habit of following the checklist before submitting documents, and I was able to reduce my mistakes. After joining the company, I will make my own checklist and try to handle it meticulously. "When I was in college, one of the games that I was responsible for my enjoyment was ""Tiny Farm." Whenever I turned on the game, I used to feel good by coming across the logo with Com2u's unique smile on it. In order to give users constant pleasure, the story and cute characters of the game are important, but I think it is most important to provide seamless service. I applied to provide enjoyable game services to users who use Com2uS. My biggest advantage is that I can handle both network and script language at the same time. When the network is not large, it is not a big problem even if I check the equipment one by one and deal with the failure. However, there is a limit to operating the network manually when the size of the game increases and the number of games served increases. We will automate network operations step by step through the development of scripting capabilities, which is an advantage. Through this, we will try to make the network a solid foundation for Com2uS' business expansion in the future."" "I have three months of internship experience working at a network company." During the internship, I monitored network networks around the world and learned basic troubleshooting, ip management, and impact management from work. By analyzing complex topologies, I learned the components of the network such as routing protocols, vlan, and ip, and learned security policies such as filter and acl. It also increased our understanding of network redundancy and improved stability through the structure of vrrp, glb, and spin-leaf. In addition to simply interpreting the created network, I have experience in designing and implementing the network myself. In gns3, we implemented a network connecting three as using Juniper and Cisco equipment. We used bgp, ospf, and static routing protocols, and we checked that the two hosts at the end communicate with each other through routing tables and ping tests. We can also handle script languages such as shellscript, java, c language, python. While we were working on it, we implemented a passwordless ssh connection through shellscript. After embedding the password in the script using the expect script, we made it enter the password automatically when we tried the ssh connection, and the result was successful. We will use these scripts to drive the automation of our operations to increase the efficiency of our network operations.",,

"Important Value I Learned in a Hard Time" When I just entered middle school, my family was very difficult due to the bankruptcy of my father's company. Since my parents were busy and my sister was a high school student, it was just me and my sister until 10 o'clock. Even though I was young, I thought, "There is no one to protect my home except me," so I came back home right after school. I naturally learned responsibility and understanding by eating meals with my younger brother and sharing the cleaning process. As a result, I was able to build a smooth teamwork by sometimes taking on the role of a responsible leader and sometimes a reliable colleague during the project. "The power to overcome fear, challenge" There was one trauma to me. When I was in elementary school, I was elected as the class president because of my friend's joke, but I was eliminated after receiving only four votes. The shame I felt at that time was hurt when I was young, and when I stood in front of the audience, my whole body trembled and I couldn't speak well. This personality affected me until the beginning of middle and high school, and when other friends focused on my presentation, my whole body would tremble less without realizing it. To overcome this, I applied to show off my best friend and the national song. To prevent me from getting nervous, I covered my face with a scarf and even put on sunglasses. I sang "My Accidental Accident" with the choreography in front of more than 500 people, and I proudly failed. However, there were audiences who laughed at the performance, and it was a fun stage for me as well. Through this, I learned how to overcome trauma and enjoy being nervous. There were several times when I was nervous when I took the SAT or when I presented a project, but I used to get better results than when I practiced. To overcome a problem, it is my philosophy of life to confront it head-on. I will develop myself by bumping and breaking it, and fully absorb what I have realized. "Up my professionalism with concentration" My biggest strength is that I have good concentration. When I fall into one thing, I often fall into it so that I can't see my surroundings well. When I was an undergraduate, there was a project that soldered to form a circuit, and I had the experience of finishing soldering in just one day. Thanks to this, I was able to focus more on coding projects afterwards. This personality will contribute to developing my expertise in InnoWireless, and further developing the company's technology. I will concentrate better than anyone else, saving time to eat and working on developing skills. "A "perfectionist" One of my biggest weaknesses is that I try to complete every little thing perfectly. In my fourth year of college, I had time to take a mock interview and fill out a survey at a job center. At that time, other classmates answered simply within a line, but I wrote down everything I felt and the basic line was over three to four lines. The problem took that much longer and all the classmates had to wait for me to finish. I repeatedly understood that I was in a "simple deficit" due to their stinging eyes, but I was finally able to let go of my pen when I was done speaking. This was helpful for the development of the job center, but it could hurt the feelings of my classmates. Later, I regained my relationship with them, saying, "I'm sorry to have kept you waiting." I will work hard for the company, but I will maintain good relationships with seniors, colleagues, and juniors who work together with my unique knuckles and closeness. "One complete product made by 10 errors" I have experience producing "Smart CCTV" through Raspberry Pi and C language design during my undergraduate years. Since it is inefficient for a person to control CCTV 24 hours a day, we have implemented a function of self-judging a dangerous situation, informing the manager, and recording the video. First, connect the Raspberry Pi with the camera and then perform image processing using an open CV. When an object approaches, the image processing result is notified to the main server and the video is sent. In this process, I took charge of socket communication between Raspberry Pi and the main server and took the role of implementing it in C language. We designed with Raspberry Pi as a client and the team member's laptop as a server, and used TCP/IP protocol. We used WLAN (WIFI) and gstreamer for video streaming. It was successful to connect the server and the client, but there was a problem with video streaming. After the screen was displayed for 2-3 seconds, the program stopped with memory-related errors. To solve the problem, I looked up books about open CV and gstream in the library, and I even got advice from people I study with. As a result of my efforts, I found that I only imported the video from the while door that fetched the frame and did not release it. As a result, memory shortages occurred and the program was terminated. Later, by releasing variables, I was able to solve the memory shortage problem. When I work, I believe that there will be more errors than successful ones in the development process. I will read and grasp the company's previous development documents carefully to correct these errors, and become a new employee who develops by listening to seniors more precious than ever before. I found InnoWireless very attractive in three aspects: "Aptitude, vision, and corporate culture." The first is aptitude. As an engineering student, I had a high interest in network development to the extent that I studied communications on my own. It is a dream of mine since I was an undergraduate school to strive to develop next-generation communication technologies such as CDMA, WCDMA, and small cell at InnoWireless. To this end, I am ready to do not mind high-intensity work or overtime. The second is the vision of the company. Under the vision of being a world-class company, InnoWireless is investing boldly in technology development rather than immediate big profits. For example, he was selected as a small cell supplier for telecommunications companies and became the first in the world to commercialize small cell technology, proving the high technological prowess of the company.We decided that it is a company that has the power to leap to become a world-class company through the virtuous cycle of investment, technological improvement, and value-added creation. The third is the corporate culture. I believe that the characteristics of InnoWireless's corporate culture are 'fairness' and 'emphasis on talent'. Above all, I felt that it was a well-motivated environment for self-development in that it provided specific standards and compensation for judging performance. In addition, I was able to feel the careful consideration of developers as welfare benefits for the operation of dormitories, provision of meals and healthcare. Through these three things, I applied as I thought we could grow together in mutual trust.""Three Promises for Growth Recently, mobile operators are not only seeking to expand coverage but also to improve service quality through efficient management of surging data traffic. To this end, they are making great efforts to develop new technologies and secure frequencies. I believe that one of the technologies that should be supported in order to develop these new technologies is OAM technology for wireless networks. After joining the company, I will try to secure the best OAM technology in Korea. First, I will adapt to my work by listening to the seniors' bitter words. I think what is much more valuable than learning through books is the words of seniors who come into contact with practical work. I will write down this carefully and find my own manual that I look for whenever I get stuck in my work. Second, I will try to acquire new skills by reading ten professional books a year to improve my professionalism. Europe's network technology is one step ahead of Korea's. I will study how to acquire advanced knowledge through original texts and papers and add them to the company's technology at all times. Third, I will work hard on the education of juniors. I think that for sustainable development, consistent training of juniors should be carried out. When all four wheels of a car run together, a car can move forward. For the development of InnoWireless, I will listen to the seniors and work hard to cultivate juniors below."

[Importance of collaboration with other companies] I was interested in the database field, so I took the 'Big Data Manager' course organized by the IT Business Promotion Association of Korea as well as the department class and carried out projects such as Java programming and data architecture design. While working on the project with students from various departments, I was able to hear various opinions on things that I did not think of or missed. I think that cooperation with other companies is important as well as the company's technology. Samsung has affiliates in the fields of electronics, finance, and heavy industry. Collaboration with the former and the financial sector can increase the competitiveness of the service and create synergies. In addition, Samsung Electronics is actively promoting cooperation with foreign companies such as the U.S. and Europe, so I applied because I thought there was a great potential for development. My dream at Samsung Electronics is to become the first in the world share of the program I made. I think a good program should be able to easily use the functions that the user needs. While programming, I always thought about the user's position."[What Mathematics Problem Solving and Programming have in common] I have liked solving math problems since I was young. No matter how difficult a problem was, the process of solving it by substituting basic formulas and principles felt enjoyable, and this was the reason why I chose the natural world and chose engineering when I went to college. However, object-oriented programming that I took in my first year of college felt different from solving math problems. The screen in English felt like a different language, and I didn't think there would be rules. So, I went to the military with poor grades in the first grade programming subject, and while I was taking classes related to programming, I was forced to take a course called system programming due to failure in registration. It was a class that I entered belatedly, so I often visited the professor to ask for a class registration and to ask questions about the previous class, and this led me to focus on the class. What I felt while learning the C language in the system programming subject was similar to solving a math problem. Code, which I thought was just a list of English words, had a rule, and the process of using the rule to output the desired result value was as interesting as solving a math problem. The fact that I had to spend a lot of time to find single letter mistakes, minor mistakes in the use of phrases, and the fact that external problems other than code problems occurred sometimes felt difficult, but all of these processes gave me an opportunity to improve my programming skills. Since then, I became interested in programming and had a dream of becoming a developer. [How to work together in a strange job] I took a leave of absence to go on a trip to Europe, which was my dream since I was a third grader at university. And I immediately worked for two months at the Samsung Semiconductor Research Institute in Suwon to save money. At first, I was very tired from unfamiliar work, and it was even more difficult to work with strangers all day long. I didn't go home, but lived in a lodging house, so I had to wait more than an hour for me to wash up after work, and I just felt uncomfortable going to bed. However, the more I worked, the more enjoyable my team members who were close to each other, and I envied the more they were recognized for completing and taking responsibility for the work. So from the next day, I went first, talked to him, hung out, and if there was anything I didn't know, I started first, and tried to ask him exactly. When I opened up, it didn't take long for us to get to know each other. Since then, the work has become a little more enjoyable and I have felt a lot of rewarding like never before. No matter what kind of work I do, I have found that if I have a good relationship with the person I work with, I can work more happily and the efficiency of my work increases. Since then, whenever I want to achieve my goals by collaborating with someone, I have always tried to maintain a good relationship with people.","[Big Data Analysis and Prediction] Among the recent social issues, the issues that I am interested in are big data analysis and prediction. Big data prediction is the prediction of what is most likely to occur statistically based on the collected data. As the analysis and prediction of unstructured data such as SNS and reviews increase, as well as structured data, many areas are used, many issues arise regarding big data analysis. The first is the accuracy of big data prediction. In order to increase the accuracy of big data, I believe that individual analysis and prediction are as important as those of a large number of people. Unlike in the past, when similar people gathered to work, individual diversity of people is respected as people with diverse thoughts gathered to create synergy. In big data analysis, it will be more important to make predictions by analyzing a person's consumption patterns, hobbies, and eating habits rather than by analyzing a large number of people of similar age and place of residence. Rather than analyzing a large number of data unconditionally, I think it is necessary to provide a prediction service tailored to each individual through various aspects of analysis. I think cooperation with other companies is necessary because it is necessary to collect user data through various routes. The second issue is the invasion of privacy in big data analysis. In this regard, I believe that strengthening the security of data should be prioritized. The value of data is increasing because big data prediction tends to increase in accuracy as the number of data increases. However, if data that you do not want to be collected is collected and used for analysis in the process of collecting data, you may think it is an invasion of privacy. That is why I think we need to strengthen the security of our data.",,,,
