Among the usual convenience store businesses, GS Retail's convenience store had a positive image as it was the most cost-effective store. Even if you buy a triangular kimbap, other companies only offer discounts on the price of drinks, but GS25 gave you small joys such as gifts. Seeing how they studied the taste, cost-effectiveness, and trend of lunch boxes and fresh foods through the FF research center, I was deeply impressed by GS Retail's craftsmanship, which focuses on quality rather than marketing and advertising. "I found that I enjoy learning new technologies that I had no idea about or am interested in in in the computer engineering department. When I first got a smartphone in my freshman year, it was a shock like a new world. So, I wanted to create a program that I could use on my smartphone, so I looked for courses in C language, Java, and Android lectures and app, Inventor courses at universities. Not satisfied with it, I wanted to experience how apps were developed in a working environment, so I went to the suburbs to give lectures on Android by the KISA and field trips at start-up companies. The experience of making my own in-depth Android knowledge and experience, such as parsing, DB management, market upload, profitable marketing skills, gave me interest, vitality, and fun in the IT industry. Beyond learning these new technologies, the movement that aims for application will not stop even after I join the company." After joining GS Retail, I want to work in the IT mobile department, which will benefit from my experience as a college student. When I saw the GS25 app currently on the market, I had original ideas such as refrigerator and point accumulation, but it really hurt me to see that many customers gave me 1 out of 5 stars when installing the app, because they required too much authority, used too many resources, and had frequent errors. If I join the company, I would like to create an edge browser instead of Explorer, which will perform better, and take the example of how I could ignore legacy codes that I have followed since the old version, and develop the app from scratch to optimize and stabilize functions so that it can function smoothly regardless of which customer's smartphone is. This is because stability and scalability are indispensable elements in websites, apps, and programs.""I think my strength is the affinity I gained through various challenges and experiences. I didn't have this competitive edge to start with. After failing to retake the job, I was so clumsy that I was rejected as a part-time job seeker. So I thought I needed to change, so I applied for a theater club where I communicated with the audience with my whole body. In addition, I decided that I needed skills to socialize with people of various characteristics, so I gained a lot of experience by applying for the Marine Corps. Now, I can approach anyone and continue the conversation, and I can freely express my opinion. What needs to be corrected is concentration. As I couldn't sit for a long time and my grades dropped until the first semester of my third year, I recruited study personnel to attend the library and certify my study time, thereby creating motivation to focus. In addition, I successfully received an A+ in my major subject for the first time after making efforts to pack two meals for efficient time management." "My experience of learning the power of honesty was when I participated as a mentor at a basic educational center on campus. The goal was to improve the academic ability of first-year students who could not complete required liberal arts courses. At that time, I had a lot of learning ahead of my senior year, so I could start preparing for mentoring at 2 a.m. But one of my juniors told me that sometimes they only met one mentor, took a certified photo, and received the support fee without a single class. However, my ethical value is, 'Always be proud of yourself,' and I never intended to break it just for convenience. So I thought about how to teach them efficiently in a short period of time, and organized and taught them what I needed to learn in my senior year in high school, TOEIC, and TOEIC Speaking. As a result, I got first place in my special semester test. From this experience, I have deeply learned that honest efforts can overcome challenges no matter how hard they are.",,,,

[Start of Communication] The values in life are 'Let's communicate.' These values were formed from the time I was in elementary school. I served as the president when I was in the fourth grade. I started communicating with the teacher by giving her suggestions and complaints. The teacher took appropriate measures accordingly, and delivered her words to her friends as well. Through this, I was able to create a good atmosphere in my class and finish the school year without any accidents. Through these experiences, I learned the importance of communication, and I was able to further improve my communication skills by serving as the president in the fifth, sixth, and middle schools. [Clear after Rain] In 2015, I had an experience of breaking through the competition ratio of 21:1 by demonstrating the power of communication that I had formed when I was young. I participated in the OO Global Challenger by forming a team with my friends in the fields of IT, electrical and electronics, and industrial engineering. However, I had difficulty in deciding on a topic because my interests were different due to different majors. I was able to decide on a topic in the following way. First, I had a meeting with my team members every day. They came to topics that matched everyone's major and discussed which of the various topics was practical and objective. Second, I listened carefully to my opinions. Rather than deciding independently as a leader, I set a common goal by listening to my team members' stories. In this process, I was motivated and could come up with more ideas. Based on this method, I was able to decide on a topic that covers everyone's major. After the topic was decided, several majors could gather and approach it from various perspectives. Based on the synergy effect, I came up with a practical and objective topic, and I was able to pass the document screening process through the competition ratio of 21:1. [Life of communication] I think the definition of communication is 'achievement'. Because of good communication with my team members, I was able to achieve my goal and achieve good results. If I had good results by launching good services, I think I was able to communicate well with customers because I understood their needs well. After joining the company, Dow Technology will show good results not only through customer stories but also through communication with internal employees and related technology companies." [Dreaming Developer] I made the following efforts to become a program developer. First, I took courses in C, C++, Java, and Android. Through this, I was able to deal with various languages and learn the differences between each language. In addition, the practice was conducted based on the assignment. We produced 'search word ranking program' using C++, 'shopping shopping mall program' using Java, 'mini-game heaven' using Android, and 'Please take care of a working mom'. In addition, 'unmanned parking' project was carried out through the Opencv library and C++ language. I experienced various types of languages based on various practice. Second, I learned the basics and skills of programming through data structure, algorithm, and database subjects. We dealt with algorithms and data structures through algorithm problem sites. Through this, we could learn how to design with an emphasis on optimization and efficiency. Third, we learned about Linux systems through the subjects of system programming, operating system, and embedded computing system. I worked on various projects based on the Linux system. As a graduation work, on the Raspian OS system, we conducted 'Smart Home for Working Mom' using Raspberry Pi and sensors. In addition, in the subject of 'embedded computing system', we conducted a router practice, which is an embedded board. We modified the device driver and controlled the function of the router. [Tennis club participated in many competitions] I worked in tennis club for 3 years as a club member. I learned tennis when I was a freshman, and I became a senior and taught tennis to my juniors. I led my juniors and participated in many tennis competitions. I participated in various competitions such as the National Tennis Club Competition held in Yanggu, Gangwon Province every summer, and the Gyeongin District, where universities from Seoul, Gyeonggi Province, and Incheon participated, so college students from all over the country with the same hobbies gathered and played tennis games to improve their skills. By learning tennis, which is called etiquette sport, I was able to develop respect and consideration for others. I also developed teamwork and communication skills between seniors and juniors."" As I liked to meet people, I worked part-time at a service job mainly. 1. I worked at a bakery for 3 months. I was responsible for overall business of the store by myself, including customer service, counter work, cleaning the store, and bakery packaging. 2. I worked as an assistant for 13 months at the cram school. Due to the nature of the academy, I was able to meet customers of various ages, mainly targeting parents and students. In addition, I was able to feel the atmosphere of the actual company by using the same office as the employees and those in the general manager's position. As an intern, I worked as an intern at the graduate lab for a year. I mainly worked on the project based on the Linux system. 1. Based on Raspberry Pi and EV3, an automobile robot, the unmanned parking project was carried out by myself. On the Linux-affiliated Raspian operating system, OpenCV and cameras were used to detect the parking line. Through this, we implemented a system that automatically parks by controlling the speed of the wheel motor according to the location of the parking line. 2. As a graduation work, we conducted 'Smart Home for Working Mom' with two people using Raspberry Pi, various sensors, and Android. Based on Raspberry Pi and sensors, we composed gas valves, interphones, air conditioners, refrigerators, fluorescent lamps, and distributor smart home devices. We created the 'Please Take Care of a Working Mom' app and implemented a system that can control smart home devices with a smartphone. Among them, we played the role of developing various smart home devices. In addition, we built a web server to bring smart home devices together, and we were in charge of implementing Android and web servers for post communication.As a result, by implementing a highly completed system, I was among the top five teams out of 70 teams in the free competition for embedded software and won the Presidential Award by ranking first in the competition for excellence and graduation work on campus. The strength of this is responsibility. I have experience that impressed customers through part-time jobs at academies. This experience gave me the opportunity to be recognized by my employees, and I was able to feel a sense of belonging after working continuously for 13 months. Through this, I learned a lesson that if I do my best with responsibility in my duties, I can be recognized by my customers and internal staff. In 2013, I worked part-time as an assistant at an cram school. The assistant's main duties included student management, and the overall supervision of the institute, including House of Representatives, PC management, telephone reception, reading room management, and vending machine management. Among them, when giving guidance to the House of Representatives to ensure that students get on the bus home, the academy bus heading home departed home at the same time every day, and students rarely missed the bus. Then one day, I found a student who missed the bus. The bus had already left and was unable to go home, and the student said he did not know how to get home and had no money to take a taxi. I thought it was my assistant's role to guide the student to arrive home safely, so I decided to take the student home even during rush hour. I contacted the student's mother and asked her home address. I took a taxi with the student and left the house after finishing the House guidance. The next day, the student's mother thanked him and presented him with snacks and letters. This incident allowed me to receive praise and recognition from my staff. Also, whenever I went to the House guidance, I paid more attention to prevent the same thing from happening again. Through this, even after I quit my part-time job because of my studies, they called me whenever I needed a hand so I could constantly be recognized for my ability. Through this, I think that customer emotion is a 'responsibility'. This is because I was able to impress customers when I did what I had to do with responsibility. I will faithfully play my role based on responsibility at Dow Technology, which provides the best service for the impressions of customers. Through this, I will make efforts to expand the market while increasing the satisfaction of related technology companies and customers. The disadvantage [of meticulousness who received scholarships] is that I am meticulous and tend to be a bit late in handling work. I am usually meticulous and can't be satisfied when I work without being perfect. Due to the nature of engineering college, which has many assignments in each subject, when one assignment is completed completely, there were many cases where other assignments were submitted without completing them because the deadline was numbered. To overcome these shortcomings, we prioritize work and prioritize work that can be done quickly. Therefore, I received three scholarships by completing assignments and projects in all subjects. "After joining the company, I will become a new employee who takes advantage of my strengths, complements my weaknesses, and demonstrates my abilities at Dow Technology." My motto [8/128's achievements through hard work] is "Let's make efforts." If you make efforts, you will get good results in the end. Breaking away from the existing training method and applying a new training method, I became the first among 128 teams to achieve quarterfinals at the 2014 National Tennis Club Championships. When I was a member of a tennis club, I did not do well at the National Tennis Club Championships for several years. Ahead of the competition, club members lost their confidence and tried to put meaning into participation without a goal. As the guidance manager in charge of training, I thought that the reason why I could not perform well was a problem with the training method. I had a meeting with club members every week and set my goal of advancing to the finals, and through feedback, I changed the training method as follows. First, it is 'Experience.' The training method, which was focused on the basic skills, has been changed to focus on the actual games. In the training, each other practiced against each other and conducted the actual game, and after the game was over, they gave advice through feedback. Second, it is 'eye-level education.' In addition to regular lessons, we invited juniors who were not good at it and conducted customized training with them. I transferred their know-how, and I was able to develop my confidence through encouragement. Through this, I became closer between seniors and juniors, and I got the effect of killing two birds with one stone. Lastly, it is 'voluntary.' I trained every day two weeks ago, and changed the training date to three times a week from one month ago. This is because I thought consistency was more important than cramming. In addition, each was encouraged to voluntarily attend three times a week, thereby developing autonomy and responsibility. As a result, my skills and teamwork improved, and I was able to achieve the quarterfinals for the first time ever in a competition involving 128 university teams. Based on these experiences, I learned a lesson that you can achieve good results if you try hard without giving up. In addition, I was able to feel the importance of change without being bound by the existing methods. After joining the company, when there is a situation where the result is bad or difficult to solve, I will not give up and try to find a solution. Rather than doing it alone, I will discuss it with my team members and solve the problem by trying different ways without being afraid of change," said Lee. "I was interested in new IT technologies, so I planned a smart home project. Because I dealt with areas and realities of my interests, I was able to feel interested and develop them, which led to my winning the prize. I think this experience is consistent with the direction of Dow Technology, which communicates with trust and challenges with expertise. After joining the company, Dow Technology will apply new IT technologies and release customer-oriented products that apply trends. I have experience working part-time at an cram school. One of the main tasks when I worked part-time was answering the phone calls from mothers who asked if the students arrived at the institute safely. Through this, I was able to understand the practical concerns of working mothers, and the biggest concern of working mothers is for working mothers who can keep their child safe at home alone

Netmarble, the cornerstone of mobile games, was introduced to countless games when using its first smartphone after being discharged from the military. At the time, mobile games showed two great possibilities. The first is accessibility. Even before smartphones were developed, there were many kinds of mobile games and companies, but accessibility was not good. However, the fact that games can be easily downloaded and played for free with just a few touches has changed to make it easier for users to access them. The second is profitability. By creating a system that allows users to download games for free and pay extra while playing, contents that can help them play were not burdensome for users in the store, and the developer thought that it was a good structure to make a profit. This idea gave me the determination to jump into the game industry after graduation. The times have changed rapidly and the game industry has grown rapidly. As a result, the innovation shown by your company has come in an extraordinary way. I think Netmarble's innovation has led to the base of Korea's current mobile games."" "Jukmagou" "Stone Age" with 10 years of experience. "Stone Age" is an attractive game that I can't let go of yet, as I came across after watching the movie Jurassic Park when I was in the sixth grade of elementary school. First, the elements that I had fun playing Stone Age for 10 years were the progress of the game on a turn-based basis. The game in which enemies appeared randomly when there was movement in the field and played on a turn-based basis made it easy for adults to play with a simple manipulation method. Second, there is a pet growth rate system. It was fun to raise one pet each because the growth rate was applied differently to each pet, and the range of growth was different depending on the properties of the same petra. Lastly, it is a reincarnation system. If you raised a character to a certain level, you could be reincarnated through a mission, but you could receive a pointer after reincarnation based on the stat distributed to the character before reincarnation or whether the mission was completed. I believe that this reincarnation system provided a foothold for the players to build stronger and stronger characters, and continued to play for a long time. "Scholarship You're Mine" After the first semester of my freshman year, I looked at my report card and tuition bill and set my goal for college life as a full scholarship. I can't forget how I felt sorry for my parents at the time. However, in the second semester of my freshman year, I repeated failures and went to the military. After being discharged from the military, I decided to set strategies and change methods. Unlike when I just sat down and memorized things, I did communication and projects through question-and-answer methods and study groups, increasing my participation in class. However, even though I got a score higher than 4.3 in the first and second semesters of my sophomore year and the first semester of my junior year, I didn't receive the full scholarship that only one student received. Still, I worked hard and achieved the goal of full scholarship from the second semester of my junior year to the graduation semester. Like all students, I wasn't very interested in my studies. However, through this work, I realized that effort requires a method, and in the end, persistent effort is the most important."I think the most important thing in the modern constructivist paradigm is communication. It has become an era in which cooperation between multiple people produces better results than a single genius idea. I have experienced the success of collaborative thinking while working on a team project in college. At that time, the progress of the project was decreasing due to a disagreement between the team leader and the team members. The deadline and progress of each part of the project did not match, and the limit was reached. So, I took on the shortcomings of the team members and tried to complete the project by persuading each team member again to complete the part. Naturally, I took on the role of the team leader, led the overall progress of the project, giving presentations, questions, and answers to the presentation, and bringing out good results and harmony among the team members. "Challenge through experience" Everyone sets the direction of life, but they don't always go where they want to go. However, the person who achieves what they have planned is called a successful person. I learned that hard work changes lives even with my life so far. When I first encountered the game on Netmarble and played it until now, I thought that I was working in a related job at any time. I will not be frustrated even if Netmarble does not join the company. As usual, I will think about my shortcomings and what I need to develop and implement them without hesitation. First, I will build a career in a competitive but small-scale mobile company, go overseas and gain 'experience' that I lack the most from various people. Through this experience, I will gain skills and receive offers from your company.","" Computer Basic and Practice, Logic Circuit, Programming Language and Practice I, Data Structure and Design, Big Data Entrance, Program Language and Practice II, Engineering Design Entrance, Programming Writing Techniques, UNIX Programming, Software Engineering, Application Programming, Information. Computer Science and Guidance Law, Computer Network and Data Communication, Database, Algorithm, Entrepreneurship Capability Enhancement App Development, Compiler, Computer Structure, Operating System, Entrepreneurship Capability Enhancement IoT Fundament, Rational Rose Object-oriented Analysis and Practice, Comprehensive Design 1, Wireless Communication and the Internet are the most interesting and memorable subjects in the second grade software engineering class that carried out the first project." In class, I developed a mobile application with my team members. Many students live alone around the school, so they usually order delivery food, but there are not many flyers, so it is difficult to order. Thus, I came up with an application that can provide menus, price information, and phone numbers to restaurants around the school. One of the additional functions along with the market research was the coupon system. Since each restaurant does not have a constant expiration date and longevity, it was developed so that the application can use it in a single coupon to make it easier for students to use it. We designed a circular image so that users can get closer and have a UI in the form of a mind map.When a user presses the desired menu and finds a restaurant that corresponds to the menu, the user's name, address, and phone number are displayed along with the picture of the restaurant. At first, only the team members used it, but gradually began to use it in the department, and the friends complimented me, "I don't have to go looking for flyers anymore." Through those words, I still can't forget how I felt when things that had been struggling at the time were unraveling. ,,,,

"Creating something out of nothing." Since I was a child, I have been praised for having unique ideas by surprising people around me by drawing pictures of future undersea cities, food, and fashion that others have never imagined. I became interested in programming that allowed me to freely realize these unique ideas and naturally went on to major in computer science. In order to develop a new concept of service that others could not come up with, I tried to build up my competence as a developer by completing a number of programming expert courses at Academy O, an educational institution for development experts as well as majoring in universities. As the first step toward surprising the world with unique ideas, I founded a fashion shopping mall called OO a year ago. It was intended to provide customers' trust and convenience through an operation method called "pre-check-and-pay" that differentiates it from the existing shopping mall called "pre-check-and-check." In addition, through the concept of providing personalized styling services, we tried to be competitive with existing shopping malls, and targeted niche markets by making men rather than women the main customers. Naturally, this became the first opportunity in the shopping mall industry to realize individual male O2O styling services, and returns and refunds were 4% lower on average than competitors. Based on these results, I was able to get an opportunity to be selected as a nurturing startup of OOO. However, despite these achievements, I encountered unexpected difficulties while developing the service due to the disadvantage of trying to solve any problem alone. During the implementation of the payment system, the PHP-based code sample and manual provided by the payment PG company were very different from the server platform Node.js, which is the server platform I implemented, so it was difficult to implement. I tried to find PHP programming books and internet search, but I wasted five days. Eventually, I asked the payment PG company for help through phone call and e-mail, and I felt a great sense of despondency when I learned that it was a problem that could be solved easily in just a day. With this as an opportunity, I am trying to solve the problem quickly by asking and learning who the target person is. Although there were many difficulties while developing the service due to its shortcomings, the responsibility of being the "owner of the service" was the driving force behind the commercialization of the shopping mall service. It was not an easy task to develop the front/back-end of the service by myself because I was the only developer in a startup team composed of various majors. However, this startup was started with my idea, and I was able to implement and commercialize the service within the target period after staying up all night at the office for three months with a sense of responsibility that no one else could take charge of development. Through the start-up of the fashion shopping mall, I practiced "passion" and "challenge" by creating the first men's personal styling service that could not be found in existing shopping malls, and I was able to cultivate "professionalism" to run out of school to develop solid services and gain professional competence by directly entering educational institutions for development professionals. [The determination to walk 800 kilometers in person for 24 days] My hobby is trekking. A year ago, I had the experience of completing the 800-km pilgrimage route in Spain by walking my own feet. I was challenged to overcome my weak willpower that could not end anything. Since I had to walk 800 kilometers in person for about a month, I have improved my physical strength through constant exercise since six months before the challenge. In addition, I prepared in advance so that there would be no difficulty in the journey by studying the route of the pilgrim, the culture, and the language of Spain. Contrary to the expectations that the first day of the journey would be enjoyable, the process of crossing the Pyrenees, located on the border between Spain and France, was very difficult and made me even want to give up. When I found my first accommodation across the Pyrenees, I felt proud and delighted that I had completed anything, which was easily giving up on anything. I wasted my day on the wrong route during the journey, got picked up by a pickpocket at a village festival, had problems with my travel budget, and I often wanted to give up due to numerous difficulties, such as walking 30 km with a heavy body wearing a raincoat on a rainy day. However, whenever I encountered these difficulties, I focused and focused only on walking with the will to finish it somehow. After 24 days of walking without giving up, we arrived at our destination, Santiago, and my heart was filled with memories of overcoming difficulties on our last journey. Through the path of pilgrims, I was able to discover myself the determination to finish everything off without giving up." "Two years ago to gain practical development skills in addition to lectures at the school, I completed various programming professional courses at the O Academy, an educational institution for development professionals. In about six months of training at the O Academy, I took professional courses in Android, mobile servers, and databases. And I experienced two mobile app development projects that I aimed to commercialize using them. The subject I found most interesting at the O Academy was Android. Java was the most proficient language of my undergraduate years, and Android, a platform based on Java, naturally felt comfortable to me. The free expression of the GUI through Android programming even made me feel like an artist who paints on a blank sheet of paper. I was also delighted that I had developed a client that could communicate with the server for the first time by implementing a Network Manager module that Post/Get with the server. While developing the Network Manager module, the process of parsing information transmitted to the Json data structure of the server's Restful API service gave the impression that it was decoding a secret. Based on this Android programming, a project team was formed to develop a crowdfunding platform service for abandoned dogs.It wasn't easy to get out of the position of being taught by someone and into a position of having to do it yourself. Especially for me, who is new to designing the architecture of Android systems, it felt difficult and complicated to draw the big picture of the service. As I worked on UX/UI with the designer and collaborated with the server developer to realize it after all, I was able to gain confidence in my career as a developer as I saw myself completing each function. In addition, through this project, I was able to gain a sense of responsibility to act as an expert in my role in a team of people in various fields, professionalism, and communication skills to coordinate opinions through smooth communication when I had conflicts with team members."" SK Encar has the industry's best used car quality guarantee service called Encar Warranty, and a "Hutstep Compensation System" for victims who purchase bait products or false items, confirming that SK Encar puts customer trust first. In addition, statistics that about 1 million cars are registered annually and the number of online and mobile visitors exceeds 400,000 every day show that customers already trust SK Encar. [Challenging to start a business based on customer trust] I think I look a lot like SK Encar in that I value customer trust as my top priority. When I was an undergraduate, I had the experience of conceiving and starting a shopping mall where customers could buy clothes with confidence. Unlike conventional shopping malls, which check products offline after paying online in advance, we came up with a customer-reliable shopping mall operation method in which clothes are delivered offline first and then paid online on the spot. In addition, by allocating one stylist per customer, we made it possible to solve customers' concerns about styling through a messenger in the app. After the commercialization of the service, I was able to get a lot of advice on styling from customers who actually used the service, and I heard that I could trust it because I could try it on and pay first. As a result of practicing this customer trust first, only 4% of all payments were returned or refunded. We have applied to SK Encar to show the customer trust-based service development capabilities experienced through the start-up of a clothing shopping mall at SK Encar, which puts customer trust first. I think SK Encar service, which customers can trust and use, is possible only when it is based on solid software technology. To this end, in the short and long term, I promise to become an employee as follows. [In line with the big data era], I will try to become an expert in the big data field, which has recently become important. We will acquire various big data technologies such as automobile and used car market analysis, machine learning, deep learning, Spark, and Hadoop, which are big data analysis algorithm technologies to identify and convey consumer trends, and apply them to SK Encar's web and mobile application services. SK Encar's service applied with big data technology will contribute to innovating consumers' automobile life. [Trying to develop various services] SK Encar will constantly challenge to develop innovative and diverse services to get closer to consumers' car life. We will systemize the essential elements of car life, such as installment financing, car washing, maintenance, and vehicle renovation, as well as vehicle purchase and sales services. To this end, we will actively embrace new IT technologies and actively practice leading service development. Through this, we will try to become SK Encar that provides higher quality and convenience to our customers. [Preparation for Global Market] Based on know-how accumulated through experience in the online/offline car sales business in Korea, SK Encar will become an employee who will lead the global expansion to realize customer impressions beyond the trust of customers around the world. To this end, we will continue to improve our foreign language skills so that SK Encar can expand overseas at any time." [Teamwork learned through club activities] During the winter vacation of my third year at university, I studied Android programming with the desire to commercialize the program I developed myself. I joined the EP Development Association Club OO because I thought it would be fun to develop it with many people rather than alone. OO was an external club composed of not only computer engineering students but also various university students such as business, philosophy, English literature, and design. These members were classified into planners, designers, and developers, and they formed a team and selected a topic to develop an app. In the meeting on what kind of app to make in the first team, we each expressed our opinions on the app we wanted to create. I always wanted an app that comprehensively stores and manages favorite URL strings set through Internet browser apps such as Google and Naver. Accordingly, I presented this to my team members and started to create an app with the function with the consent of the team members. At the beginning of the project, when designing functions and screens with my team members, they drew pictures on a blank sheet of paper, and each came up with a lot of strange but popping ideas. Seeing that designers or planners put out screen compositions or functions that I couldn't come up with, rather than developers, I realized why a team project should consist of people from various fields. It was a situation where the design of both the function and the UX was completed and the app was only developed. However, it was more difficult to implement the function than I thought, and in the end, the app could not be developed within the period. Due to the great feeling of self-blame and responsibility that I did not fulfill my role, I entered T Academy, a development expert education institution, and completed the Android and mobile server expert course for 6 months in order not to repeat these mistakes. I led the study by serving as the study group leader to share the middle and high-end Android technologies I learned at T Academy with the club developer team members. Through this, the development capabilities of all club developers were improved, and most of the teams were able to implement the applications envisioned in the team project that was conducted later. I have a lot of experience not only in internal activities of the club but also in external activities. I have participated in competitions or idea competitions several times with my club members. The 2014 Samsung Gear 2 hackathon competition is the most memorable of them. This competition was to develop Tizen OS-based applications that run on Samsung Electronics' Gear 2 products for 1 night and 2 days. A week before participating in the competition, we are fully prepared, including selecting the topic of the application, selecting the members, and dividing the roles. The theme is to develop a navigation application on the wrist for the visually impaired.In order to fulfill my role in development at the time, I applied for a Tizen programming book as a desired book at the school library and prepared for the competition by self-taught. On the day of the competition, we developed applications in a way that matched our roles. Although the competition was given a tight deadline to sleep one night and two days, we were able to complete the application development by the time the next morning's sunrise by relying on each of our team members. Perhaps because of my efforts, I won the OO Award for highly social contribution application among the outstanding teams of competitors. I still remember the impression that 'all of this was possible because of the cohesiveness of the team members.' Through the OO club, I was able to learn the sense of cooperation that unites toward the same goal as team members and the sense of responsibility that each member must work on the project with a sense of ownership in order to implement it were also good experiences. "I was praised for having unique ideas since I was young. I became interested in programming that allowed me to freely realize these unique ideas, and naturally, I majored in computer engineering during college. As the first step to surprise the world with unique ideas, I started a fashion shopping mall called 'OO'. In order to differentiate myself from the existing shopping mall operation method of pre-payment and confirmation, I came up with a rather unconventional operation method of payment after pre-payment. In addition, in line with the recent trend of increasing interest of male office workers in styling, we came up with a personal styling service with male office workers as our main customers. After the commercialization of the service, it gained the reputation of being the first O2O service in the shopping mall market and was selected as a nurturing start-up company of OO. Through my startup activities, I gained confidence that my unique idea can inspire people greatly. However, there were also difficulties in these achievements. Due to my shortcomings that I did not rely well on others, I encountered unexpected difficulties in the middle of service development. Once the payment system was implemented, the service could be commercialized. I had no experience in implementing the payment system, so I tried to implement it by looking at the code samples and manuals of the payment PG. While the code samples and manuals provided by PG were PHP-based, the server platform I developed was unable to obtain relevant information because it was Javascript-based Node.js. I wasted 5 days trying to solve this problem alone, but I couldn't. Eventually, I asked PG for help through phone or e-mail, visited the practitioner in person, and learned it, and I learned that it was a problem that could be solved simply in a single day. If there is something I don't know to compensate for the shortcomings of not relying on others for my ignorance, whether the target is a senior or a junior, I am trying to build up my quick competencies by approaching first, asking and learning. I think OO was possible because of my advantage of 'keeping the principles even if it is urgent'. In development, I did not overlook the important design and the principle of documentation based on it. From the beginning of the design, we designed and analyzed the functions necessary for the service with the planner to document the Restful API and DB table structure. I thought this was an essential principle for the expansion and efficient management of the system structure in the future. I conceived UX/UI together with the designer and made the design guide line for the efficiency of UX layout development. By documenting the initial functional design, unnecessary function implementation was prevented in advance and time was not wasted. In addition, we were able to reduce the designer's effort by developing it by referring to the relevant document without asking the designer one by one during UX implementation with the design guide line document. Thanks to this, we were able to complete and commercialize the service about a month earlier than the initial planned development period. In addition, I think the responsibility of being the owner of the service was the driving force behind OO. I was the only developer in the college student start-up team consisting of various majors such as management, design, and fashion. Obviously, developing the service's Front/Back-End system by myself was not easy. However, I developed the service all-night for three months in the office with the responsibility that no one else could take charge of the development because it was started with my idea. Because of my principles and responsibility, I was able to realize my idea, OO, and I was able to have a valuable experience of starting a business.",,

I have the experience of developing a fashion shopping mall based on the O2O structure a year ago. I applied because I thought that my development capabilities best fit SK Planet's O2O Platform development. As an engineer of SK Planet, I want to become an expert in O2O Marketing Platform architecture. We will open a new chapter in the consumption culture by providing optimized shopping information and convenient shopping experiences for individual customers, going back and forth between mobile and offline. In order to become an expert in O2O Marketing Platform architecture, I have built up my experience and competence in the development job with the mind of constantly challenging myself as follows. First, through the start-up experience, I realized the customer-oriented Platform service by understanding it from the customer's point of view through the start-up of a fashion shopping mall called OO, which practices customer-oriented business, and melting the customer's needs into the service. In addition, by developing an O2O Platform-type commerce service, I was able to understand and personally experience SK Planet's Platform Business philosophy. Second, improvement of development capabilities through T-Academy. In order to gain professional development capabilities, T-Academy, an educational institution for development experts operated by SK Planet, showed passion for completing two courses of experts in Android and mobile servers in succession. In addition to development capabilities, T-Academy has gained teamwork skills to solve problems with people in various fields, as well as understanding and communicating skills and communication skills through team projects. Third, after learning practical skills through internship at a solution company for 9 months, I experienced practical organizational culture and developed technical skills, responsibility, and perseverance that practical developers should possess. Through these capabilities, I will contribute to SK Planet becoming a global Platform Business company leading the global market."[Self-Honoring] I have experience working as an intern at a company whose main business is producing LTE modem chips and developing solutions until recently. During my internship period, I had the opportunity to participate in a firmware development project for smart meters that send and receive data that measured the power consumption of each home to and from electricity companies. My role was to implement a socket server that received data on the amount of power measured by clients through socket communication. I was nervous because it was a relatively big task, but I decided with the responsibility of implementing it perfectly because the team members trusted me and entrusted it. Not long after I started developing the function I was in charge of, I encountered difficulties. When the socket server was initially implemented, the server handled the process of accepting the client's socket connection request in a blocking manner, and if two or more clients send packets at the same time, the server could not receive them in order, resulting in a file descriptor error. I tried to solve this problem alone, such as socket programming books and internet search, but I couldn't solve it and wasted three days. After suffering alone, I decided that it would have a big impact on the project deadline, so I ended up explaining the cause of the problem and what needs to be resolved to the senior developer within the team and asking for advice. I was advised by the senior developer that changing the part that was treated as a blocking structure to a non-blocking structure would solve the problem, and the code was modified with that structure. Since then, not only two but also 10 clients sent packets at the same time, no problem has occurred. Realizing that it was a problem that could be solved easily in just one day, I scolded myself for almost having a setback in the project's progress due to my pride in trying to solve it alone. With this opportunity, I try to solve a problem by myself for a day when it arises, and if it is judged that more time is required, I try to solve the problem quickly by asking and learning who the target audience is."" AlphaGo, which has become a hot topic recently, shocked our society by winning against Lee Se-dol, Korea's top Go player. Big data is a big part of AlphaGo's decision-making method. As such, big data technology will gradually change society as a new way of making decisions. SK C&C has ICT capabilities for data collection and analysis, and is active in various fields of society based on big data solutions. I think big data technology will be the main food that will lead SK C&C's growth now and in the future. I learned about big data in the Department of Statistics, and I wanted to work in a big data club and handle data. Based on my statistical knowledge, statistical programming, and interest in big data, I want to increase my expertise in big data to contribute to SK C&C's big data capabilities. "I have been a scholarship student at the school library for a total of one year since I was a freshman at the university. My job was to scan and edit old books. However, when I tried to use the scanner, it stopped roaring and I had to repeat the same task to scan one page. Nevertheless, because the scanners were expensive, I didn't dare to fix them, and everyone was scanning so slowly. Increasingly conscious of the problem with the slow speed of work, I started to find a solution. I observed the movement of the scanner when I pressed the scan button, and I studied why it wasn't working. After observing the scanner, I found that the machine lacked the power to move, and I found that if I pushed it by hand before it stopped, it would scan normally. Although there was an inconvenience of having to keep pushing the machine while standing up, I was able to process one copy per hour, which was done every few minutes, and I was able to hear compliments from my staff. After going through this, I thought that in order to innovate, it was necessary to constantly pay attention to and observe the field."" As a freshman, I joined an on-campus classical music appreciation club and have been active until now. After working in the club for six years, I spent much of my college life hosting various club events such as the club's 40th anniversary events. As I spent a long time, there were many conflicts among club members. As one of the conflicts, there was a junior who particularly hated the chairman. I was dissatisfied with everything that had been set and walked away, and both the chairman and the club members were stressed out about it. I was close to my junior unlike everyone else, so I was asked what happened, and I was told that I felt betrayed by the chairman, who was close to my junior, who was asked to leave the club due to past incidents. I came to persuade my junior members by standing in the position of defending him so that he could get along well in the club, and whenever he said bad things to the chairman, I was able to resolve the conflict within the club by telling him.","" In July 2014, I applied for an internship for the operation of the Youth Panel Survey and the Aging Research Panel, which was conducted from OO under the commission of OO, and worked for six months. As a statistics student, I was interested in surveys that collected statistics and wanted to learn about my future company life in advance. My job was to produce surveys and manage personal information of researchers and panels. However, I was not used to coding a programming language for surveys that I had never seen before, and I had a hard time with the volume of surveys being very large. As I wanted to complete my work successfully, I searched for applications and Internet documents and studied them. As the deadline approached, I worked overtime until midnight, and I finally completed the survey within the deadline and was able to complete it in December without any problems. After the project, I had dinner with various departments and felt proud that I had successfully completed the project. Through the internship, I was able to learn data processing and communication between departments."" "I attended the Department of Statistics and took statistical analysis such as regression analysis and time series analysis. In addition, I learned MSSQL and R programming by taking courses such as computer data processing and data analysis and design, and in particular, I got an A+ in the R programming class, which made me interested in statistical programming. During the internship period, I learned a new language by learning survey programming tools called Blaise and Confirm. In addition, I was able to experience company life and project execution by constantly communicating with other departments for the project. In the big data club that I joined after the internship, I learned R and Python programming for big data analysis. In addition, I was able to experience data analysis in real life through projects within the society. Since we were not participating in an external contest, we all had time to program after discussing the direction of the analysis with significance. The first project I did was predicting moviegoers. The box office api data provided by the Korea Film Council was downloaded and processed so that it could be analyzed through R or Python, and the number of spectators for three days was predicted by considering similar movies and the number of spectators by day of the week. The next project was a project to crawl posts on Naver's cafe bulletin board using Python. Our group crawled through posts from meetings of people who sent their boyfriends to the military, and analyzed which groups of couples did not break up until they were discharged. In addition, to find out the characteristics of separated couples, we analyzed the posts of separated parties and visualized the mainly used words. I want to be in charge of big data at SK C&C. In particular, I want to do something that is helpful to society by using public data. I want to study the programming necessary for big data such as Hadoop and R, and I want to participate in projects in various fields to increase my experience. My goal is to be a big data expert after being with SK C&C for a long time.",,,,

[There is no tree that cannot climb!] When faced with a really difficult task, I confronted them with the idea that there is no tree that cannot climb. It was time to work on a design project for a coffee vending machine in the logic circuit subject. We went beyond meeting the requirements and proceeded with this project with the goal of designing a vending machine like a commercial vending machine. At first, I looked at the internet and drawings to find out the algorithms and principles of how they operate. I applied that principle to design and program a gate circuit, but I was unable to proceed with this project due to an unknown error. So, leaving the project aside, after referring to related books and studying other instructions, I reviewed the design process and found that there was an error in adjusting the time of the input waveform on the test bench and corrected it. The idea of making a vending machine that can be put out on the market was an opportunity for me to try to develop more program skills that I lacked the idea of making a vending machine that could be put out on the market, and I was able to complete this project successfully. Even after joining IDIS, I will set my sights on a high point, and then I will pursue my own challenging attitude, which is my strength." [Always ready to help!] When someone else is in trouble within the IDIS team after joining the company, I am confident that I will always lead them by giving them help. It was time to take a test in dance sports, a liberal arts course. The paired Spanish Emma and Elena did not speak Korean, so they fell behind in class, so the professor looked for someone to help them. At that time, I offered to help. The two-member dance was organized through a situational play of a man who was conflicted between the two women, using a different situation than the three of them. I taught them the dance and steps I learned using all the methods I could, and I stayed in the practice room and practiced supplementary to get together with the two. And after the practice was over, we completed our teamwork by eating together. In the end, I got a perfect score in originality and compositional score on the last test. Through this experience, I had a chance to think more about the definition of helping others. However, if you help others with the full time and effort that you can spend, sometimes you can't concentrate and use all of them. I think this is because I didn't know how good I was at covering it and helped them first. In order to fix this, I try to reflect on myself and try to help before I can help. As I realize that there are many cases where it helps me in the end, I try to be more helpful in the way that I can. After joining IDIS, helping a team member in need is ultimately for the whole team, and furthermore, for the whole team, if there is a team member in need, I will step up and lead with the help.","" Communicative Developer!" My S/W Development and Big Data Technology are my strengths in performing the S/W development task of IDAS. To make up for the practical process of big data competency that my major knowledge is lacking, I took the Big Data Manager Course from the oo Association. I learned JAVA, Oracle, Hadoop, and R through the training. And based on this, I worked on four team projects with people from other majors, such as humanities, statistics, and others, rather than just a team between majors. As a result, I was able to work on projects such as Indigame Development, Police Station Management System, School Web Application, and Employment Personnel Management System. This gave me an opportunity to upgrade my S/W development capabilities. In addition, I participated in the 'DA Design Contest' and modeled the data on the human resources management system of a company. While conducting data modeling that meets the company's requirements, I was able to have practical experience of B2B, which is different from B2C. Through this S/W development experience and various experiences of B2B and B2C, I was interested in and applied for IDIS's S/W development job." When choosing a company, I choose based on the following criteria. Is it a company that I can learn from? I want to join a company that makes me more curious about myself 5 or 10 years after I joined the company. It was when I was in the first grade when I was in the programming club. I developed my programming skills through information exchange with seniors who used basic education and public lecture time. At the end of the semester, I learned programming skills and achieved good grades in programming-related subjects. While working as a club, I experienced myself growing up along with my programming skills. Also, I thought it would be the icing on the cake if I could work in an active attitude with interest. By contributing to IDIS by developing through learning, I would like to promote growth together and become a member of IDIS that I am curious to see in 5 years and 10 years from now. I will tackle the task with passion and finish it with my own hands. I remember the moments when I participated in the Campus Patent Strategy Universiade and tried to overcome and challenge myself passionately for 3 months. In order to solve the problem, based on the understanding of technology, patents, and intellectual property rights, the technology and patents were analyzed and the possibility of infringement, invalidation, and avoidance design were presented through the analysis. First, the main components of the patent were analyzed to understand the patent in question and the technology in question. However, there was a limit to understanding the technology at the company level. So I searched for basic books related to technology and studied them deeply, and tried to understand the technology by reading explanations on the background technology in hundreds of papers. Then, I found related patents and papers based on the technology analysis. Of the thousands of patents obtained by searching the key components of the patent with keywords, we found a total of five key prior art documents related to this patent.Since the patent in question was a U.S. patent, as a result of persistent review of the data sheets of the products related to this patent by the leading communication equipment companies in the U.S., we found that this patent could be invalidated by oo's products. In addition, judging that there is a possibility of invalidation of this patent through prior art literature, a solution called avoidance design was proposed to compose the design by changing the core parts that may infringe on this patent in a different way. Through the analysis, we found a product related to the possibility of invalidation of this patent and also found the possibility of patent infringement by other prior literature. There were many difficulties in the process of solving the problem, but we analyzed the problem with the idea of 'be an expert in this patent more than anyone else'. As a result, we were able to get good results. I will take the responsibility and passion for the work gained through this experience to work in the S/W development department of IDIS.", "???, I will take on the task of the S/W development department of IDIS."

[Leap of Signage Business] When I was in college, I developed interest in the signage business by working on my graduation work 'Project to Improve Subway Kiosk'. In order to increase the interest in using the kiosk that was inadvertently left unattended in the subway, we announced a plan to activate the kiosk by combining Kinect's motion recognition technology. We controlled the kiosk through hand gesture recognition and promoted the recommendation menu by category to promote the local community, increasing the interest of users. Although we did not win the prize at the graduation exhibition, we were evaluated as a positive system that will activate the kiosk of the subway. The interest in the signage business was raised by cultivating and cultivating basic knowledge about Java, JSP, HTml, and DB during the JAVA curriculum, which completed in August, we prepared for the future by honing our development skills to create a link between the web and objects. In May, Samsung Electronics announced a signage system that usually uses it as a general mirror through its 'mirror display' and provides various information on beauty and hair care if necessary. It led communication with users, not simply delivering information. I believe that the signage market is such a growing field that all existing walls of the world are called potential markets. I will become a member of Samsung SDS and lead the company into B2B's representative business by developing not only displays but also system solutions that control them."[Life of OOOs like a bamboo] When I was in fourth grade, OOO first encountered the science box and connected parts directly to broaden our understanding of the principle of power and operation of machines. When I was in sixth grade, I participated in the Incheon Science Box Assembly as an autonomous theme, and completed the space station I imagined and received the bronze medal within the limited time. Although I was young, I applied the principle of power using provided parts and motors based on creative ideas, and I was able to achieve good results by demonstrating my dexterity and concentration. The sense of accomplishment that I felt at that time gave me a good opportunity to decide to major in the future in engineering. After entering college, I learned the importance of ideas to change our lives conveniently and effectively in the creative engineering design class. I had a class that presented ways to improve uncomfortable systems in school in IT. Through brainstorming, we came up with various ideas, and among them, we decided to improve the problems of the school's academic system. Because there was only one academic discipline on campus, students were always crowded and there was a long line outside the restaurant to buy meal tickets. In order to solve the problem of the delay in mealtime, we proposed a change to a system that allows students to pay directly with a card as a vehicle passes through the toll booth in a high-pass manner, and we calculated the expected system structure, development period, and development cost and presented it in the class. The professor praised it as a good system to improve the problems of learning. Currently, the school's academic discipline has been changed to a system that allows payment by card like high-pass, providing convenience in school life. Bamboo will not sprout in the first year if it is buried in the ground and fertilized, and then it will finally sprout in the fifth year and grow by 20m in about 90 days. The engineering interest I have developed since childhood has been filled with knowledge through IT-related activities through computer engineering major selection, and in the fourth year, I have demonstrated my skills through the subway kiosk project using my graduation work Kinect. "I will fully demonstrate my dexterity, meticulousness, and concentration in my ICT development and operation job with a creative perspective that allows us to pay attention to our daily lives and move toward a better environment." "[Pocketball Go's potential for augmented reality development] Recently, the most popular game in the global game community is Niantic's Pokmon GO. It is an augmented reality smartphone game created using location-based services that swept through the App Store and Google Play Store in 24 hours when it was released in North America on July 6. People flocked to New York's Central Park to catch rare Pokmon, and the fact that it will become a Pokmon GO in only some areas such as Sokcho in Korea sparked the Sokcho tourism craze. I, too, headed to Sokcho to catch Pokmon and enjoyed the game passionately, collecting a total of 43 kinds of 160 monsters for two days and one night. Many companies rushed into the augmented reality market to the extent that it was said that they needed to develop a Korean version of Pokmon GO, but about two months later, as the popularity of Pokmon GO cooled, the number of users and sales dropped sharply compared to the installation of the app, and problems were raised. First of all, it was difficult to communicate smoothly with users due to the problem of bugs due to the system that has not yet been stabilized compared to the high interest, and we were busy reflecting on successful cases that we did not have before without properly analyzing the cause. With augmented reality technology in full swing, I think the biggest challenge for us is how to lead the long-term driving force rather than ending the initial market frenzy in a single shot. In addition, it will be important to pay attention to new technologies that have great potential for future development first and take an active attitude to lead the market change. Samsung SDS introduced Cello VWS, a warehouse management system using virtual reality, in March, and supplemented the limitations of the logistics site through remote monitoring using VR outside the warehouse. In the future, augmented reality will complement the problems of the real world and provide convenience to users, and will be useful in the home, medical, and defense industries. We need to break away from the passive attitude of our society and actively take the lead in the future market.",,,,

[Develop is My Life] Since childhood, I used to draw pictures of future undersea cities, food, and fashion that others could not have imagined. People around me were surprised by my paintings and praised me for having unique ideas. I became interested in programming that allowed me to express my unique ideas freely like on a canvas, and naturally moved on to the Department of Computer Science. Although it was the first failure in society, the two things I could get from starting a business are the passion to become an expert and build development capabilities, and the ability to communicate with team members regardless of job to create better services. The reason I want to become an S/W developer is that I feel that the moment of development is the most valuable moment for me. In addition, the process of uniting for one goal with diverse people felt the most enjoyable to me. The easiest and best way to express my unique ideas, which is quirky but unique, is programming, and I will continue to build up my competence as a developer without stopping to value myself.","1) Smart Meter Project / OOO / 2016.05 ~ 2016.06 - Project Introduction: It is a project to develop a Firmware Solution for smart meters that collects electricity usage data from each home and sends it to electric companies by loading it on LTE signals. - Development Environment: [Linux / Ubuntu 14.01], [C, Shell / Eclipse CDT], [SVN / GCT SVN Source Storage] - In charge Development: Implementation of Multi Client Socket Server ??? We developed a socket server that receives the power data measured by the application through socket communication with the Multi Client Socket Server client. It was developed with a Multi Client Connection structure because it has a structure where multiple clients send packets at the same time. It was also implemented in a TCP socket structure for packet transmission reliability. While implementing the function, if more than one client transmits packets at the same time, a file descriptor error occurred that the server could not receive in order.As a result of analyzing the problem, it was because the server handled the process of accepting the client's socket connection request in a blocking manner. At the same time, the problem could be solved by modifying the blocking structure to a non-blocking structure so that the server can receive packets sent by multiple clients asynchronously. Through this project, we were able to accurately understand the principle and structure of socket communication and the difference between synchronous/asynchronous communication. 2) Smartfren MIFI Andromax M2Y Firmware Development / OOO / 2016.01~2016.04 - Project Introduction: It is a project to develop Firmware of 'Andromax M2Y', a pocket WiFi of Smartfren, one of the Indonesian telecommunications companies. The device is a portable router that enables data to be used using 4G LTE signals using Pocket WiFi. - Development Environment: [Linux/Ubuntu 14.01], [C, Shell, javascript/Eclipse CDT], [SVN/GCT SVN Source Storage] - Responsible Development: Marvell WiFi Application Control Daemon Development, Network Advanced Settings Function Implementation, WiFi Disk Implementation ??? Marvell WiFi Application Control Daemon Development CPE Web Page that allows users to change WiFi setting information through Host IP. The client was configured using HTML, JavaScript, and Jquery, and the web interface was implemented with Cgi. We developed the Linux Daemon program to control WiFi applications and set WiFi configuration information through this Web Page. ??? Network Advanced Settings Implementation A number of filtering functions have been implemented for indiscriminate intrusion and restrictions from external networks, such as barriers. MAC Filtering that allows/blocks access to specific MAC addresses, IP Filtering that controls access to specific external IPs, URL Filtering that blocks access to URLs with specific strings, and Port Filtering that blocks access to specific ports. In addition to the filtering function, we also implemented a Port Forwarding function that allows external access only to specific ports and forwards to specific internal IPs. The above functions were implemented as Linux applications to run Linux Kernel and were developed using C. In addition, Trigger was developed as Shell Script so that the application runs Linux Kernel. ??? WiFi Disk An WiFi disk that can use the File Storage function is implemented through a WiFi signal on that device. The UI was developed through CPE Web Page. Cgi and WiFi disk applications were implemented using C, and the File System Command for Linux was configured to be set through Shell Script. WiFi disk functions include File Upload, Download, Delete, Renaming, and Create Directory. In addition, a preview function was implemented to allow media files such as Image/Text/Audio/Movie to be previewed on the Web UI. During the implementation of this function, there was a problem that buffer memory overflow occurred when the file size attached to the Web Page was more than 1GB. The cause of the problem is that when files are transferred from the Client, they are divided by 256 bytes and then written to the memory at certain intervals after being accumulated in a temporary buffer on Linux, which was caused by Linux not being able to write to memory as quickly as the size of the transferred buffer. To solve this problem, the size of the transfer buffer for Lighttpd, which was used as a web application at the time, was modified from 256 bytes to 128 bytes. Since then, the problem has not occurred even if a 4GB file is sent. 3) OO Mobile App Development / OO / 2015.01 ~ 2015.07 - Service Introduction: It is a project to develop an O2O service for men's personal styling subscriptions. - Development Environment: [Java(Android), Node.js/Eclipse], [MySQL / MySQL WorkBench], [SVN / Subclipse] - Responsible Development: Complete Client Development, Middleware Server Development, DB Design and Construction ??? Network Manager module for Layout implementation according to Client Side UX design and communication with the server was developed through Android. In addition, we developed the data parsing structure of the public data Open API for delivery status and road name address information. In addition, it was linked with PG's payment system for payment. We developed Restful API service middleware server using ??? Server Side Node.js. For scalability and flexibility in service system management, Restful API definition and Json definition were documented. In addition, we built Server Hosting using Amazon AWS EC2. ??? DB member table and product table were organized into many-to-many relationships to efficiently manage information on purchase history. In addition, a one-to-many relationship was defined so that one stylist could be assigned to each member so that the information of the customer he/she manages can be checked at once on an app dedicated to the stylist. In addition, for the accuracy and reliability of payment for product purchases, we built a database through InnoDB's MySQL considering transition-safe. In addition, using Amazon AWS RDS, we used DB Server Hos
