[Challenging to start a business to create something out of nothing!] Since I was young, I used to draw pictures of future undersea cities, food, fashion, etc. that others could not have imagined. When I saw my paintings, people around me were surprised and praised me for having unique ideas. I became interested in programming, which allowed me to express my unique ideas freely as if I were drawing on a canvas, and naturally I went on to major in computer science. I continued my interest in programming not only through my major learning but also through my activities as an app development club. By the time I was in my fourth year of college, I had a desire to develop a service through programming, and I set a goal of surprising the world by realizing my own unique idea into a real service. In order to develop a real service, I felt that my major knowledge alone was not enough, and I kicked out of the well called the school and entered T Academy, an educational institution for development professionals. By completing two courses by experts in Android and mobile servers at T Academy, I was able to develop enough services to actually implement them. As the first step toward surprising the world with unique ideas, I started a fashion shopping mall called 'OO' a year ago. We wanted to provide customers' trust and convenience through the operation method called 'Preliminary Payment After Payment', which is differentiated from the existing shopping mall called 'Preliminary Payment After Confirmation'. In addition, we tried to make it competitive with existing shopping malls through the concept of providing personalized styling services, and targeted niche markets by targeting men rather than women. This naturally led to the realization of individualized O2O styling services for men for the first time in the shopping mall industry, and returns and refunds were made at an average rate of 4% lower than competitors. Based on these results, we were able to get an opportunity to be selected as a nurturing start-up for SK Planet. [Lack of flexibility] However, despite these achievements, we had an unexpected difficulty while developing the service due to the disadvantage of trying to solve any problem by ourselves. During the implementation of the payment system, the PHP-based code samples and manuals provided by payment PG were very different from the server platform Node.js, which I implemented, which made it difficult to implement. I tried to solve the problem through PHP programming books and Internet search, but I wasted five days. I eventually asked the payment PG for help through phone or e-mail, and when I found out that it was a problem that could be solved simply in a day, I felt a great letdown. When a problem arises through this opportunity, I try to solve the problem quickly by approaching anyone first, asking them, and learning. [Responsibility as much as a professional] Although there were many difficulties during service development due to these shortcomings, the responsibility of being 'the owner of the service is me' was the driving force that led to the commercialization of shopping mall services. It was not easy to develop the Front/Back-End of the service by myself because I was the only developer in a start-up team composed of various majors. However, this start-up started with my idea, and I devoted myself to the development, staying all night in the office for three months with a sense of responsibility that no one else could take charge of it. After these efforts, I was able to develop the service within the target period and successfully commercialize the service. The 'challenge' to surprise the world with my unique ideas, the 'pioneering spirit' that created the first men's personalized styling service for shopping malls, the 'patience' and 'responsibility' that I should not finish what I started, and the 'development capability as professionals' that developed the entire system front/back-end through the start-up of shopping malls. I will exert my utmost efforts to help Hana I&S be at the center of innovation in the Hana Financial Group by utilizing these five capabilities. "I have worked as an intern for the last nine months at a company focused on producing LTE modem chips and developing solutions. During my internship, I participated in the firmware development project for the smart meter, one of the core technologies of smart grid. A smart meter is a digital electronic meter that transmits power usage data measured in real time in each home to an electric company through LTE signals. My role in this project was to implement a socket server that receives the power consumption data measured through the client application through socket communication. I was nervous because it was a relatively big task, but I made up my mind with the responsibility that I would implement it perfectly because my team members trusted me. Not long after I started developing the function I was in charge of, I encountered difficulties. When the socket server was initially implemented, in the process of accepting the client's connection request, the socket was created in a blocking structure. Because of this, if more than one client transmits packets at the same time, the server first receives only the packets from the client that created the socket and does not receive the packets from the rest of the clients. To solve this problem alone, the server tried to communicate with each client through Multi Thread when creating a socket with the client, but it showed not only rapid performance degradation but also unstable system behavior. Eventually, I couldn't solve it by myself and wasted three days. After suffering alone, I decided that it would have a big impact on the project deadline, so I explained the cause of the problem and what needed to be resolved to a senior developer in the team and asked for advice. By changing the part treated as a blocking structure to a Non-Blocking structure, I was advised by the senior developer to implement it as an asynchronous socket server, and the server code was modified. First, the blocking socket was changed to a non-blocking socket through the fcntl function. After that, the file descriptor (FD) change was detected through the select function before the recv function receiving packets from the client was called.This allows servers to receive packets from all clients simultaneously, even if a particular client's packet transfer is not complete or there is no data to send. The project gave us an accurate understanding of the structure and principles of socket communication, and by developing synchronous/asynchronous sockets ourselves, we have the ability to design and implement contextual socket structures. In addition, by developing socket servers ourselves, we have created a variety of development capabilities, including the ability to implement Linux applications, compiling in Linux environments, and managing source revision through SVN within team projects. I will use my full capabilities to become an IT employee with diverse and solid technology so that Hana I&S can become a leading smart finance player.",,,,

I'm sure that the consistently cultivated ability will quickly adapt as a family to "entering school" and become a person who will be able to become one and help others while performing his or her duties.",""[Problem-solving ability through consideration and collaboration] I think that the basic skills that a developer must have are consideration and collaboration among team members. Unlike the projects carried out by developers, I was able to broaden the range of perspectives and thoughts that I develop from the perspective of users by having a meeting with a designer who approaches UI. Personal project!] I was interested in using RSS a lot around me, so I have done a personal project using RSS. While working on the project, there was a problem that I had no experience with spring and that RSS was unfamiliar. In the case of spring, since it was my first time, I thought it would be good to receive reference materials and proceed with it, so I asked the professor to study the materials that seniors had conducted in class. While looking at the references, I set the overall framework, and I added functions to the framework by applying content that is not in the references, such as sending emails through gmail, through Internet search. During the project, I solved the obstruction by looking at the answers and materials left on the community sites from the Internet search. However, in the case of RSS, it took a lot of time because it was completely unfamiliar. I also searched for RSS through search and asked my acquaintances while doing external activities, but I couldn't get the answer I wanted because it was unfamiliar. However, I really wanted to solve the questions, so I kept searching and looked it up and found that fetching information through RSS was a kind of parsing. After learning that it was a kind of parsing, I searched for materials centered on the keyword parsing and found out that there are many libraries for parsing. We found a library suitable for the java environment, selected and decided to use one called Jsoup, and tested it. In the end, we succeeded in using the Jsoup library to get the information we wanted through RSS and use it in the format we wanted. After importing and processing the information, I used it from the user's point of view, and I thought it was uncomfortable to see, click, and go to the article page.So, I thought it would be effective to implement a paragraph summary algorithm and apply it to the contents of the article so that the core contents of the article can be understood only by the summarized contents. I decided to implement a paragraph summary algorithm, and I thought about the logic of the algorithm while searching on the Internet under the keyword paragraph summary. In the end, the logic of the paragraph summary was implemented so that the key paragraphs could be found by checking the frequency of the words in the article and prioritizing the paragraphs with the words with the highest frequency. Although there were several crises like this, I was able to get the desired results by solving them one by one. While working on this project, I could feel that passion and testing from the user's point of view are also important. I was able to see the earnestness and importance of the project because I was passionate about the part that I was unfamiliar with the technology called spring and RSS, but I looked for and asked until it was resolved. When I thought about the part I did not know at the time of development from the user's point of view, I was able to find the complement point of paragraph summary, and I could feel that it was important to consider both the user's position while developing. This project is the result of these two things. As such, I will keep in mind what I felt this time and not forget it.

I am a person who is responsible for the results. My father worked abroad for about 10 years from my elementary school to high school. My father worked for a construction company and worked in the Middle East. After entering high school, I began to study far away. Then, while I was video chatting with my father during my second year of high school summer vacation, he said, "I believe in you. I was able to work with my family because I believed in you. He said, "Don't trust me in the future." I shed tears. Since then, I have decided to change and actually acted. I thought I should take responsibility for what I am doing. However, I lacked the basics and I spent a year in re-employment after my third year of high school. There is something I gained by successfully spending that year. It is self-control. I studied according to the set rules every day for a year. It was very difficult to study a set time and a set amount every day. But I thought it was a promise to myself and I studied hard for a year. So I think I gained high self-control through re-employment. I have developed a strong mental strength to overcome long project tasks or intense tasks in my job at Lotte Capital it." [When you think about them from a customer's point of view, the answer is visible] I have experience in solving problems within a group by thinking about them from a customer's point of view. In the first semester of my third year of college, I participated in a group of supporters run by the Korea Copyright Commission. During the group's activities, our team wrote a quiz about promotions on a panel that we produced ourselves. Our plan was to give out self-made gifts only to citizens who took the quiz. However, the planned day was humid and hot, so the citizens were not interested in us. So I told my team members that I needed to change my plan. My plan was not to give them a gift if they got the quiz right, but to give them a gift first and give them a quiz. However, one of the team members objected, saying that if that happens, they will not receive a quiz confirmation and only the gift will be wasted. My team member was right, too. There was a high possibility that only gifts would be wasted. However, I expected that citizens would not easily walk away if they received the gift first. So to persuade my team members, I held the panel by myself and said I would do the mission for 30 minutes. Then, the team members who opposed said they would approve if the performance was higher. I proceeded the mission in the way I thought, and the result was twice as good as the previous method. Then, the team members who opposed agreed with me and completed the mission together. It was my experience to identify the problem, find the cause, and find a solution accordingly. In the case of it job, reading ability and the ability to find the problem quickly are important. I will use the analysis power gained from this experience to help Lotte Capital."", and "As a graduate of the Department of Management Information, I have gained knowledge in business administration, SQL, and JAVA. I have the advantage of being able to understand the other person's intentions well. When I was a scout intern, I was asked to do short research in a short time. Although I didn't have enough time, I set my own standards and researched them according to my priorities. Through this experience, I will find and deal with tasks with a high priority among many tasks first. On the other hand, my weakness is the lack of efficient time distribution for many tasks. I learned this at university, and after that, I put a time limit on one task. So, when there is a set time, I perform other tasks to prevent myself from being overly immersed in one task. These efforts have resulted in fewer mistakes even when I have to deal with tasks at the same time." Samsung SDS is the most notable company in the domestic ICT industry with its own development solutions. I really want to get an opportunity to work for Samsung SDS, which goes beyond the limits of the ICT industry and at the same time returns value to society. It is because I thought that just as engineers need humanities knowledge, humanities need practical knowledge. In particular, as I prepared for employment, my interest in IT technology, which was most closely related to my real life, grew. As I study networks, I am learning that the technologies used in real life are composed of various algorithms. In addition, I am learning how to solve problems in a troubleshooting manner, not a humanities problem-solving method. With my network knowledge and SCSA, I want to become a security expert. It is predicted that the use of IT security will become even more important in the Internet of Things (IOE) era. As a security expert, I want to create a standardized management system like the cello of Samsung SDS. Through this, I will not only generate revenue but also make sure that the world's IT technologies are used safely." "I loved answering and presenting in class. Discussions with various friends were also fun. In order to improve my presentation and discussion, I became interested in logic. In order to develop my logic, I took the course of Formal Logic. In addition, I learned a book called "Local Thinking" with the recommendation of my professor in order to develop logic that can be used in practice. After that, I am interested in solving logical problems and read related books. In order to participate in solution development, logic is essential. In the process of collaborating on solution development, I need logic to support my opinion. Also, logic finds the root causes of various problems and helps solve problems. I will be a member of Samsung SDS that presents opinions and solves problems based on this logic. It was when I was studying after entering college. I wondered if I was a person with good personality. I wondered if I was ready to go out into society and communicate with others without prejudice. I started a bath service for the disabled by joining the disabled bath service club Happy Bubble. Bath service for the disabled was not an easy task. It was also traumatizing to see a disabled person naked for the first time. It was very difficult physically to bathe a disabled person who could not move. While volunteering for the disabled for more than a year, I talked with them a lot. I felt that I was a person who had the same concerns as me, such as family, romance, and work. I was able to talk with them, sympathize with them, and make friends with the disabled. Through the bath service for the disabled, I was able to feel the joy of sacrificing and giving to myself. In addition, I felt the importance of giving away prejudice and sincerely communicating as if I were naked through volunteer activities. I would like to share my heart and communicate with various stakeholders including team members at Samsung SDS. In addition, through communication with customers, I will become an employee who provides the services that customers really want at Samsung SDS. The field in which my major, the humanities, is most in the spotlight is ironically in the IT field. And it was world-leading IT companies such as Google and Facebook that started to emphasize the humanities. Google and Facebook have something in common. These companies have abandoned their stereotypes from the perspective of developers. They have created an environment where users can use them more conveniently from their perspective. This change of perspective enabled them to survive the fierce competition. And at the center was the humanities perspective. In this respect, I think the convergence of IT technology and the humanities is very important. The areas that Samsung SDS is investing in as future growth engines have in common is convergence. "I want to develop a service that takes advantage of the values of convergence at Samsung SDS." "In the global shipbuilding industry, Japan regained the top spot in monthly orders in January 2015 for the first time in six years and eight months. In February 2016, Samsung Heavy Industries ranked third in the world in terms of backlog of orders, giving Imabari Shipbuilding another third. The shipbuilding industry is considered one of the most important industries in the Korean economy because there are many projects linked to the front and rear and it has a significant impact on the local economy. The Japanese shipbuilding business, which had a global market share of less than 10%, was able to regain its global ranking because it continuously invested in new technologies and improved productivity through two major restructuring to cope with the recession after the oil shock in the 1970s. In the case of Imabari Shipyard, it established a shipyard specializing in LNG and worked hard to develop technologies such as developing eco-friendly ships. At the same time, the Japanese government encouraged restructuring, such as providing up to 80% of the ship price of the merged company at an interest rate of just 1%, and provided funding in consideration of the characteristics of the shipbuilding industry, which can easily fall into a liquidity crisis due to its low capital turnover. In Korea, STX, formerly ranked fourth in the world in shipbuilding, is also reducing 800 people through legal management and securing stable profits through business restructuring and streamlining orders. Judging from the cases of STX in Japan and Korea, I think the following efforts are needed for the shipbuilding business, the main industry in Korea, to dominate the global market. First, human and business restructuring should be carried out to improve the fundamental constitution to improve productivity.Second, we need to increase technological development. Through this, we need to secure stable profits in the future. Third, we need appropriate support from the government to secure liquidity. Through these three efforts, I believe that we will be able to secure the competitiveness of the domestic shipbuilding industry in foreign countries, and through these efforts, we will be able to have a positive impact on the local economy, exports and employment.",,,,

When I was in elementary school, I saw students sitting in front of a computer and programming at a computer academy run by my father. I was attracted to this and had a vague dream of majoring in computers. After that, I went to college with only a vague dream, but I was just stuck in learning unfamiliar languages and theories. At this time, what came to mind was a lesson of my alma mater, 'If you want to grow up, serve others'. I decided to immediately put what came to mind. First, I sat at the front of the classroom and actively asked questions, participated, and served the professor in my heart. As the content that I had never understood caught my head and eyes, I was able to proceed with undergraduate projects and projects. As I served not only the professor but also the seniors actively, I found myself developing my ego outside of study. It was only then that I understood the lessons of my alma mater, which I had never understood in high school, and from then on, I became my values. Since then, I have been learning with a low attitude while serving a big person. I attended the CES 2013 held in Las Vegas. I experienced new IT technologies from world-class companies at the CES, the world's largest electronics exhibition. It was an opportunity to look at many companies and feel that unless they settle for the current performance and make progress, they will lose their competitiveness and will be eliminated. Since then, I have always kept the two words "development" in mind while running. My goal is to strive to achieve my childhood dream of becoming an IT person through my values and words in my heart. After joining BC Card, I will reflect on my values and continue to improve and show myself to become a great person by serving senior citizens and customers from a low attitude to achieve my dream. "Since trust given to customers in the payment and settlement industry is related to the company's status, I have to make constant efforts to build trust. However, I believe that by providing good services such as web pages and mobile devices, I can build trust in people indirectly. I want to become an IT employee who indirectly builds trust in BC Card. After joining the company, I will quickly learn necessary qualities such as accurate understanding of the program I am in charge of and acquiring financial knowledge, grow into an IT finance expert, and provide services suitable for BC Card. In addition, I will constantly understand IT technology trends and apply new technologies to existing IT services to make efforts for better IT services. And as the head of BC Card's IT department within 20 years, I will achieve my dream of becoming the best financial computer in Korea." Based on trust, I came to think about the importance of trust, creating the effect of two trillion won in keeping promises with customers and learning cooperation through transactions." I was so interested in Linux that I was told that the combination of MYSQL and Linux was the best while studying. That story made me curious about MYSQL and the database, and I started studying. Since it is the last semester, I am studying while taking a database course with curiosity and enthusiasm for learning despite people around me asking me to leave as much time as possible to prepare for employment. The study, which started with curiosity, has turned into a joy of getting to know the database as time goes by, and I am only studying DB like a racehorse running while looking ahead. I think I need to be in the best group in order to be the best in one field, so it is not an exaggeration to say that all the information in Korea passes, and I saw the announcement on the job category that best fits my passion for my DB and network, and above all, I was encouraged to apply for passion. I think I can become the best DB expert in Korea, combined with my passion for DB, if I have the opportunity to learn about databases such as MYSQL and MongoDB from Kakao, which has the technology and data to connect people and the world beyond the limits of time and space, and make it happen, and I will do my best to make Kakao the most advanced company not only in Korea but also in the world. [Efforts for Growth] As of July 2015, I finished my sixth semester and became qualified for the article test. My goal was to get an information processing technician, information security technician, and Linux Master 1 level certificate during the second half of the year. Starting with basic information processing technicians, information security technicians to learn more about security and networks, and to study Linux, which is essential in the network sector. I was told by people around me to prepare one thing with certainty, but I started with the idea that I should do it. I prepared for the test by studying the overlapping operating system and network part first, and the additional part of the test ahead of the test date. I studied by reducing my bedtime and using my free time because I studied at the same time as my school class and part-time job, and although I was tired, I was more happy to know things I didn't know because I studied my favorite field. The unsatisfactory results were final pass for information processing technician, written pass for information security technician, and fail for Linux master, but I found that if I work hard with a mindset that I can do even if the result is not satisfactory, I can learn and feel a lot in the process. However, I will try harder to achieve satisfactory results from now on, and I passed the Linux Master Writing Test and am preparing for the Linux Master Practical Test and the Information Security Technician Practical Test in May. My next goal is to pass the recruitment of new employees for Kakao's Global Database Product. I think the greatest genius among geniuses is the genius of hard work. I will become a genius in my efforts and utilize all my capabilities for the development of Kakao." [SafeRiding] I worked as a team to create a graduation work and proceeded with the project. My team used SafeRiding to combine RaspberryPi, Arduino, and Application to prevent drivers' safety accidents and theft of bicycles with functions such as rear detection using a camera and object detection using ultrasonic waves. I was in charge of RaspberryPi. Two-way communication through RaspberryPi of data values received using various sensors such as Arduino's ultrasonic sensors, LEDs, and gyro sensors, as well as through the input of applications and GPS values should have been possible. With RaspberryPi as the server, which serves as the middle bridge, communication control between Arduino and the application, and at the same time, I assisted in the programming of RaspberryPi. I used Python and Bash Script for the programming of RaspberryPi, which is based on Linux. After many meetings and tests on which communication technology should be used to enable the most optimized communication, we decided to communicate with Arduino using Bluetooth for communication with the application and Web-Streaming for Cam Streaming. It was our first time to encounter the equipment, technologies, and languages used, and we studied each technology before proceeding with the project, filling in the gaps. In the initial test, Bluetooth programming was performed on two-way communication, but it was a problem because communication was not achieved due to overlapping channels. And even in Web-Streaming, when I accessed the URL directly from the web, I saw a video, but there was a problem that was not visible in the application. I tried many things, such as changing and re-creating the code of the Bluetooth connection program, but it was not easy to solve it. Meanwhile, while I was looking at the code step by step from the beginning, I realized that the problem was really only one sentence of the code. With that, I learned how important each code I write in programming is. The problem in Web-Streaming was solved by coding in a format other than the first code I wrote because it was difficult to find which part was wrong, although the video was properly displayed in RaspberryPi. [Experience and Learning] When I was working as an office assistant at the election committee in Gangseo-gu, Seoul, the manager suggested early voting machines and networks and gladly accepted it.I was in charge of training the employees and part-timers of each dong office on how to install and operate the equipment, and conducting and guiding tests in preparation for the day of voting. The test was conducted by checking the connection log and controlling network traffic in Gangseo-gu, and if there was a problem, the network equipment of the polling station was re-examined. Thirty minutes before the start of the early voting, I was briefed on encrypted USB execution and network connection problems in two dongs where there were no problems, and my manager and I went to the polling station respectively. Since I didn't have time to check the problem, I explained to the manager over the phone, and at the same time, I was able to set up and encrypt the hub after replacing it, and I was able to start voting on time. I think that if the skills I learned while managing the network at the district level and learning at Kakao are combined, I think I will be a talented person worthy of Kakao,,,

Although I felt heavier while running around looking for a solution, I felt that we were able to proceed without anyone getting hurt thanks to all of our efforts, so I was lighthearted. [No one knows our department] I want to make sure that no one knows the existence of our IT operation department. The most obvious thing about the existence of the IT operation department is when there is an IT problem. If there is no IT problem, no one will visit the IT department. I want to provide a stable IT environment to other departments through stable IT operation so that it does not interfere with their work, so that the IT operation department does not emerge as a concern. To this end, we will try to minimize inconvenience by understanding the characteristics of work of not only the IT operation department but also other departments by considering their perspectives. [Solving even minor problems] We developed a 'chat program using COM ports' as an undergraduate project. At that time, a code to send packets was given, but if you use that code as it is, the latter part of the message did not send well if the message was longer than a certain length. The code part was given as a basic, so it did not affect the task score, but I analyzed the cause to solve this problem. The problem occurred due to the speed difference between SW and HW, and to solve this problem, we solved the problem through a delay between message transmissions. In the end, I was able to get a good grade called A+ by solving the only problem. In this way, I will become a talented person who solves even the smallest problem without overlooking it and prepares other departments of Hanwha Life to avoid any problems. "I am a person who enjoys challenging myself. When setting goals, I always defiantly set goals and enjoy the process of reaching them. I have experience in creating a 'similar torrent program' as an undergraduate class assignment. The assignment was to produce a 'file transfer program', but since the score was set on a relative basis based on the function and completeness of the program, I decided to develop a torrent program rather than a simple file transfer program. However, to do this, I was short on time to learn many knowledge such as file distribution principles, file processing, transmission protocols, and multiple threads. So, I organized the knowledge I needed to learn, made a learning plan, and studied the knowledge necessary for development step by step. Various examples were analyzed by referring to the Internet and books, and applied to the program's development. When using multiple threads during development, things did not go as I wanted, so I visited my assistant and got help for 3 hours, and when using TCP/IP protocol, I hung on for 10 hours to solve the problem. After many trials and errors, I successfully developed the program and achieved good result, ranking first in assignment grade. From this, I learned that setting challenging goals is not smooth, but when I reach them, great achievements come along, and since then, I have set challenging goals that are beyond my ability and have been making great efforts to achieve them." When I was a re-taker, I happened to meet Kim Tae-won, the author of Young Googler's Letter to the Dead Passion, on the subway. This book was given as a gift from my homeroom teacher when I was in high school, but I did not just receive the gift and read it. Before we met on the subway and parted five stops later, Kim gave me heartfelt advice, telling me about his re-taking experience. Kim's advice comforted me, who was discouraged. That night, I read the book I received from my teacher from the beginning. In the book, Kim emphasizes passion. The passion that he does not practice is just a piece of hot water, and the qualification is not to fill in with English scores or awards, but to how passionately he lived the given time. After reading the book, I was deeply impressed, and it gave me a chance to focus on my studies again, so I successfully completed my re-examination. Even when I came to college, I tried to have various experiences for myself in the future, not just for a line of my resume. Sometimes, when I feel like my passion has cooled down and I feel lethargic, I take out the book and calm myself by rereading it. Even now, several years later, the meeting was an unforgettable turning point in my life. I will not work passively, but to become a talented person who deals with the passion of my heart.", "Can't everyone use it easily?" When I was in the sixth grade of elementary school, I accidentally purchased a PC magazine at a bookstore and became attracted to computers. As I often fixed the computers of my acquaintances thanks to my interest in computers, I found that computers have already come deep into our lives, but most people cannot easily handle them. Since then, my dream has become to make computers easy for everyone. This dream led to various mentoring programs during my undergraduate years. I participated in mentoring programs for non-majors and tutoring programs for international students to help them learn by delivering my accumulated know-how and major knowledge. In addition, I found out that my parents use the music playback app on their smartphones, but they are not familiar with the interface, making it difficult to use it. To solve this problem, I developed my own music playback app with a more intuitive interface. I researched the inconveniences of using existing apps for the elderly, including parents and uncles who are not familiar with machines, and I developed the app that has an interface that is easy for anyone to operate by reflecting this. After development, I received and supplemented the feedback to create a music playback app that is easy for people who are not familiar with machines to use. As such, Hanwha Life Insurance will also make an effort to provide a stable IT environment to other departments through my will to make computers easy for everyone to use,,,

[World Standard Bank] When I was an undergraduate at HW, SW, and Network, I was most fascinated by Network. Network makes all companies more active in their business activities and ensures a more convenient life for ordinary people as well. In order to become an expert on this network, I obtained the CCNA license and checked the virtual network with my own eyes during the acquisition process to deepen my understanding. I applied because I thought that these capabilities and interests could create synergy with SC Bank. I think a company is another starting point in my life. So, when choosing a company, I think about whether it is a company that can sustainable growth rather than just look at the current situation. In this respect, SC Bank is not only complacent about the current financial transactions, but also has an innovative goal of Digital Main Bank, and I think there are more ways to go than there have been in the future. In order to grow with such a SC bank, I will be a new employee who considers network and server system operation management and achievement of goals based on a thorough understanding of internal processes of SC bank for one year after joining the company. In addition, I will focus on understanding database so as not to neglect DATA management, and take a step closer to Digital Main Bank by obtaining DBA certificate. I will do my best to operate the system so that I can become a leader as Digital Main Bank of Korea in five years. In addition, I will be interested in ways to make more active business with not only domestic but also foreign partners through continuous development of SC bank system. In 10 years, as one of the executives of SC bank, I will proceed with the project to think about the new 10 years by establishing a network system so that financial activities that go through SC can be conducted all over the world. I will become an SC person who keeps my promise to maximize customer value, with better changes occurring with my colleagues every year."[Carefully] My superpower is meticulous analysis with my colleagues. When I was in college, I worked on a project with Raspberry Pi through a course called Internet communication design. Through the progress of the project, I learned the power of teamwork and the need for careful analysis. The theme of our team was 'library seat system'. However, we added a led notification function and a web seat management function that informs users of the seat end time, not only to imitate the current library system. We divided our parts and proceeded with coding. I was in charge of controlling the seat display LED through socket communication. At first, we thought that we could derive and synthesize the results for each part, so we performed coding work separately. When I combined the socket communication coding I was in charge of with the coding brought by the other team members, there was an error in coding because parts were not harmonized. Perhaps due to repeated errors, all of the team members were tired. However, we analyzed the coding in detail to get good grades by completing the project. As a result of analyzing the entire coding line by line, and organizing the errors, we were able to complete the project. If it weren't for the team members, I would have been frustrated and wanted to give up by myself. Also, I was able to produce results thanks to careful analysis, checking even the smallest 'dot' and analyzing it carefully. Through my superpower, I will become an employee who achieves my goals and grows even more with SC."" and "[Talent qualified for SC] I have made various efforts to become a talented person who meets the expectations of society as well as SC Bank's management policy of 'to be with you all the time." First, I have acquired not only network and database knowledge but also server knowledge in my major classes and private IT institutions. In particular, I was more interested in Network, my major, and obtained a CCNA certificate, which qualified me as a network manager and equipped me with basic skills. Second, during my undergraduate years, I conducted a Term Project related to my major, and through this, I developed meticulousness and meticulous analysis. When errors were found in the coding in the project, I analyzed them line by line and completed the project by debugging until I found them. Such meticulousness and meticulousness could lead to achievements and led to a strong sense of responsibility. Third, it is the ability to smoothly solve problems no matter what problems arise outside of my expertise. When my schedule was disrupted by a heavy rain caused by the collapse of a road during the long journey of bicycle country in my undergraduate years, I looked for alternatives to meet the schedule and had my members safely get to their destinations. As a staff member, I was obliged to ensure the safety of my team members, so I was worried that the roads would be cut off and that I might not be able to go to the accommodations I had reserved. With the permission of the team leader, I looked for the fastest way to proceed as scheduled and a school that could rent a playground or auditorium. Fortunately, I was contacted by a nearby cathedral that they would provide accommodation for cleaning, so I was able to recruit a patrol car and proceed with the schedule. Even though I was heavier while running around looking for a solution, I felt light because I was able to continue without anyone getting hurt. As such, I remain active for the safety of everyone outside of my area of expertise. I am confident that these are qualities that satisfy all of us, including our customers, through the operation of SC Bank's system." [First Mover: SC] SC Bank is considered the first mover in the financial industry. Recently, I read a book called 'First Mover' by Peter Underwood. First Mover means "leader of new field." The reason why SC Bank thought 'First Mover' was because it was the fastest to go digital. Most of the business processing in many fields, including financial affairs, is carried out by the computer, network, database, etc. It is expected that more IT technologies will be deployed without changing this trend.Although its main business is finance, it is preparing for the future by hiring IT professionals such as Network, Server, and Data. We expect that such thorough preparations will show great efficiency in the ongoing operation of the Bank Shop. In addition, we will be able to grow one step further if we have more safety in this simpler financial market. If we continue to pay attention to IT investment as well as financial security issues, I think these can be directly related to customer satisfaction. I am confident that the energy of customer satisfaction will enable us to reach Digital Main Bank, which SC Bank has aimed for, as soon as possible, and become a leader in the financial industry."[Capstone Design: Making Air Conditioners by Infrared Temperature Measurement] I have experience creating works that participate in the design of Capstone for my graduation work in college. The work we produced was an infrared temperature sensor for an air conditioner. The goal was to place it in front of the desk for office workers in Korea, which has the second largest working hours in the world, and to operate the air conditioner in accordance with the temperature. The base controls hardware parts such as motors and temperature sensors in Arduino, and Bluetooth communication with the database in Raspberry Pi, so that the cooler operates according to the current temperature values and adjusts the strength and weakness. In addition, the measured current temperature values can be viewed on the web in conjunction with php so that users can monitor them in real time. Among them, I was in charge of the Bluetooth communication part that transmits temperature values from Arduino to Raspberry Pi, the current temperature values measured by Arduino in myadmin, the database built by Arduino, and the part that transmits and expresses the current temperature values to php (web). Among them, the most memorable part was about the database. In this process, we executed an Insert command that communicates serial with a port number and inserts the data received through the 'execute' command into the database. These commands were theoretically learned through a subject called database design, but I was very interested because it was the first time to build and input values through communication. As such, just because my major is a network, I am not limited to a network, but I have gained knowledge of the database and implemented it myself through projects. Through my network and database capabilities, I will be a very helpful employee in the operation of the SC information system."???,,,

I completed a comprehensive design project and worked on a project called OpenCopter with my undergraduate students. OpenCopter is a combination of open source and quadcopter, and we started with the goal of lowering the unit price of expensive quadcopter by creating and distributing code ourselves for free. It was a short-term project, so we could have created applications or made simple programs, but our team was greedy and decided to create a quadcopter that recognizes and tracks people. It was impossible to complete the project within the period of time while working on it at the same time as my studies, but I decided to do it as much as possible by dividing it into floating a quadcopter, making an application remote control, and using a camera to recognize and track people. I was in charge of the tracking part. After receiving the video from the camera, it was subjected to a Gaussian Filter process to remove noise, and the specific color was binarized into white and all other colors were binarized into black. Thus, the direction of movement was determined by calculating the distance and angle between the center point of the white area and the center point of the video. And we created an algorithm that determines the area of the white area and the forward and backwardness by the area size. We were able to complete the project and participate in the exhibition thanks to the division of labor in pairs. However, it was regrettable that there were many shortcomings when the algorithm was produced using simple binarization processing due to the lack of time. Since it only tracks specific colors, it fell without recognizing when the person was behind the object. Moreover, since the forward and backward movement was determined based on the area alone, the range of the white area narrowed when the person looked straight ahead and turned to the side, recognizing that the object was far away, and there was a risk of collision with the object due to the quadcopter moving forward. After the exhibition was over, we tried to improve the problems by bringing an opencopter, but there was a limit to dealing with all exceptions at our level. Inevitably, we went to an Internet cafe and completed it with the advice and source of experts. I could have participated in the exhibition as a simple project, but I could learn more because I set a high goal and tried hard."********** I volunteered at a local children's center for two years. As the chairman of the volunteer group, I organized weekly meetings and helped communicate between the center and the volunteers. After a long period of time, I learned about the internal situation of the center. Since the center is operated only with regular donations, there was a limited number of people who could take care of it. The head of the center was always saddened by the fact that many children wanted to enter the center but could no longer accept the offer, and I decided to find a way to increase the donation. Back then, leaflet distribution was the only way to recruit sponsors. Palm-sized leaflets were small enough to contain the urgency of the center, and they were expensive and inefficient because they could not be distributed in many places. To address this issue, I suggested creating a newspaper called "The Story of the Persimmon Tree" instead of leaflets. Newspapers were black and white but easy to see for the elderly in large letters, and they were able to distribute them to a wide area due to the low cost of producing and printing newspapers. Every weekend, I worked hard on newspaper production with volunteers. I drew the cover myself and posted pictures of the children. The newspaper was produced in a total of eight pages, and on the last page, I expressed my gratitude by putting the names of my sponsors. And to show the transparent use of donations, I included the expenditure details. Thanks to the many volunteers' participation in newspaper production, we were able to start distributing the newspaper within two weeks of deciding to produce it. A week later, the volunteers' earnestness was conveyed, and three or four calls a day began to come in asking for sponsorship. Thanks to the new sponsors, I was able to receive children who had delayed admission to the center. Since then, "The Story of the Gamnamugol" has been published regularly and has been a great help in recruiting many sponsors. "When I was a student, I was shy, so I couldn't open my heart first. While going to high school, I joined a theater club to improve my shortcomings. I was immersed in the club slogan, "When we are apart, it is one drop, but when we gather, we become an ocean," and prepared for the performance every day. For the first month, my daily routine was to be criticized and scolded by my seniors. The stage fright I usually had did not go away easily, and unlike my initial determination, I found myself getting depressed. I thought that if I couldn't overcome my fear this time, I would easily give up on anything in the future, and from that day on, I took a video of my lines for two to three hours a day, and practiced through the mirror, discovering problems on my own. After two to three weeks of repeated practice, I was told that my skills have improved. After receiving a few compliments, at some point, I found that I enjoyed the play without getting stressed out. For the remaining two months, I participated in the practice more than anyone else. The practice time that I had hoped for the end was changed from "practice time that would be over" to "practice time that would make me feel sad to finish", and the teamwork with colleagues also increased, and in the latter half of the practice, I changed into a passionate figure, such as voluntarily practicing additional practice with the actors and editing the script. I played my role safely on the day of the performance. Although I was not the first place as an actor, I received reviews from my colleagues that I have improved more than any other 20 actors. The overwhelming feeling of praise and applause from the audience and friends of the day still lingers in my heart, as I was proud of myself for turning what I once wanted to do into the most enjoyable thing. Through this, I was able to realize the greatness of my efforts and discover the potential for my own development." "Theatrical during high school was a valuable experience that changed me." Even after going to university, I joined a club called 'San Sarang' and continued to do theater and mountain climbing activities with attachment. After just finishing my second year of university, I was given a project task related to my major for promotion to the club.It was an opportunity to receive a subsidy of 5 million won when exhibiting the project after carrying out the assignment. I recruited team members to carry out the project, but the fourth grade with extensive project experience was busy preparing for employment, and the first grade was not experienced enough to carry out the project. The operation of the membership fee for the purpose of running the club was not smooth, so I challenged the project with the goal of applying for some 3rd graders, including myself. In line with the club name, the theme was to implement an information application in the mountains nationwide, and we pledged to achieve the best results with our members and responsibility. For us who did not have knowledge of the application, the graduation project-level task was too high a wall. There was a fear among the team members, 'Wouldn't we fail?' and there were small disputes at each meeting. At the suggestion of a classmate as the team leader, he studied the amount he was in charge of in advance, made a prototype, and started a study to teach other team members, and the application was gradually completed as the study continued. Through the efforts and cooperation among the team members, we were able to complete the task within the deadline. Since most of the exhibitions were projects by the 4th graders, our works were relatively insufficient. However, I was able to get a lot of points because I was the result of my first assignment and the absence of a fourth grader. This served as a decisive opportunity to be promoted from an existing theater club to a major club, and it gave me confidence in my major. "I developed the web at BaxterIP IT team, a law firm based in Sydney, Australia. My first project was to create a responsive web. I had basic knowledge of responsive web but had no experience in implementing it, so I studied by looking at materials and sources after work every day, and I took charge of creating navigation to implement it. The next project started with my proposal. I thought that it would be helpful to attract customers if I created a bulletin board by adding a membership registration/login function and consulted on the homepage. The CEO and the supervisor were interested in my idea and focused on implementing the bulletin board for the last week. I used phpmyadmin to encrypt and store the customer's information in a DB, and when I post on the homepage, I implemented a function that is sent by e-mail. Through the intern, I have experienced and learned not only my major knowledge but also work. Although I am still learning it, I have been creating work momentum by demonstrating my supervisor's know-how and my own strengths, such as writing work mail, prioritizing work, and making plans and processing it. Also, my philosophy - 'People come before work.' I realized that the root cause of happiness and stress, big and small, at work is not work, but human relationships. Finally, what you can do today is not to postpone it until tomorrow. Tomorrow is tomorrow's work, and if you have accumulated work, you will always have a busy day, and if this continues, you may get tired. All of these are my own assets obtained through practical work. I majored in computer engineering and took IT-related courses such as data communication and database, and in the process, I laid the foundation by working on various projects. In addition, the excellent grades of data structure and algorithms prove that my analytical and solving skills are excellent. I promise that the knowledge and experience I have will help maintain SK's status.",,,,

I am a person who can fulfill my responsibilities by finding the responsibility to take the initiative in the work entrusted to me. When I had to decide something from an early age, I made my own decisions, developed responsibility, and tried to do the leading work accordingly. For example, I participated in a Chinese training program hosted by a college and took on the role of the team leader. At the beginning of the training, all of the students participated hard in class, but in the middle of the training, many students became lazy, so they oversleep and did not attend, so they came up with measures to fulfill their role as team leader. I was encouraged to go to class by getting up early every morning, getting ready first, and going to the room where the students lived, waking them up in person. It was hotter and humid summer weather than Korea, so when I walked around, I sweated for no reason that I took a shower, and I was annoyed to see my friends who were not encouraged to go together. However, I have constantly tried to do my part and have led almost all students back to class. As a result, I was able to complete the training well together, and I was able to grow my sense of responsibility by being thanked for the effort I made to my Chinese teachers as well. Based on my strengths, calmness and meticulousness, I will do my job thoroughly. Programming and software management sometimes take more time to shake mentally when a problem arises in the process of debugging that makes it difficult to know the cause of the problem. However, my calmness has been a solution that allows me to take an engineering approach to the problem without panicking when a problem arises, and to find the cause of the problem based on meticulousness. The downside is the indecision caused by listening to many people. When deciding on something, I try to listen to everyone's story to make the best decision for everyone. In the process, both this person and I have a point, so there are moments when it is difficult to make a decision, but I have made the best decision through many conversations with them. When I joined GS Neotech, I will try to find a conclusion that can produce satisfactory results for all stakeholders." "The most successful and meaningful thing was to create an application with my team members to participate in the contest. On the last vacation of my studies, I wanted to have a result that summarizes the knowledge I had learned through my major classes and the practical experience I had gained while working at the research institute, so I persuaded my colleagues to form a team with four colleagues, and among them, I took the role of project manager to achieve satisfactory results through cooperation and consideration with my team members. The first reason that was meaningful was that I was able to apply my major knowledge and practical experience that I had gained so far by participating in everything from planning to design, server and client implementation. By participating in government projects in various major classes and research institutes, I was able to adapt to various development environments, enhance my understanding of software development, and create a complete application based on this. At the planning stage, I proposed the theme of social network using beacons, and started the project with the unanimous consent of my team members, and I carried out the design based on my software engineering knowledge. Amazon EC2 cloud services were used to construct the server, and Apache, My-SQL, and PHP were installed on the Linux operating system to create a server development environment. The client directly implemented the chat and review board functions, which were key functions in the project, targeting Android. In this way, I was able to use IT knowledge in many ways by mobilizing my major and practical experience in the development process to the extent that I was told that I had completed the project by all my team members, and I was recognized for the creativity of the idea to the extent that I was judged and asked to patent the method of using the beacon. The second reason is that through communication and consideration with the team members, we have achieved satisfactory results for all team members. Two of the team members assigned a small amount due to their lack of development experience, but I saw them having difficulties in the development process. I participated in the development of the Android client for them and gave consideration to them more than I did. After completing each one, I collected everyone's quantity for integration, but the data types did not match and each had difficulty in progressing due to their different coding styles. However, through a lot of conversations, we coordinated and focused on the parts that did not fit, and realized the confidence in collaboration and the importance of communication required in the process. As a result of this communication and consideration, we won the contest and it was an opportunity to enhance the teamwork and software development skills of all team members.""I will quickly adapt to work at GS Neotech through my interest in and experience in the cloud through my academic and practical experience." Working on the project to be submitted to the contest and using AWS EC2 service as an application server, I became interested in various functions of AWS and its future potential. In addition, while working at the Electronic Components Research Institute, I was able to gain interest and practical experience in the cloud by participating in research and development tasks of the Ministry of Science, ICT and Future Planning related to virtual desktops and clouds, using a cloud management tool called Cloud Stack, and developing some of them." In addition, I gained a wide range of knowledge such as programming language, software engineering, network, database, and operating system through my major classes to lay the foundation for adapting to the computerized job. I developed software to participate in a competition with my classmates, and I took on the role of project manager from planning to planning, leading the team in all parts of design, database, server, and client programming, and developed a sense of responsibility and communication with team members. I believe that my experience and interest in cloud services can be of practical help in performing my duties as a member of GS Neotech, and I will grow into a cloud expert with GS Neotech based on this.",,

However, I had difficulty in understanding the web and developing high-quality projects for 300 hours. As a result, I challenged 'OOOOOOOOOOOOO' to make up for my lack of competency, and I had a good opportunity to receive a year of web development training. For 6 months, I learned both the front and back ends using Spring and value.js, and developed web development capabilities. In addition, I learned the Java algorithm and took the initiative in studying algorithms with my team members. Through this, I was able to develop problem-solving skills and gained the ability to share what I learned by conducting code reviews with my friends. I was able to gain practical skills by conducting team projects in the same form as in practice. The location-based travel record platform, which was born after getting the idea from Github's lawn planting, was in charge of developing the backend using JPA in SpringBoot. Since it was my first web project, I was able to experience various challenges and experiences. I was able to acquire new skills such as login using JWT token, photo management using S3, and application of HTTPS, and I was able to solve various problems during development and develop my problem-solving ability. One of them was when I was dealing with JPA, when I mapped different tables to entities, an infinite reference phenomenon occurred. This phenomenon was difficult to find the cause of the problem after the first time, but as a result of not being frustrated and referring to various technology blogs, it was caused by incorrect design. I found that the two entities were mapped in both directions, and that infinite reference occurred because the database and service were not used independently. In order to reduce the degree of coupling, the request and response DTO required for each API were separately created. Although it took a long time to modify, by creating DTO, I was able to select and send only the necessary information and solve the infinite reference phenomenon. Thanks to the spirit of challenge to acquire new skills and persistence to solve problems, I was able to successfully complete the project and receive the excellence award. As we developed the platform, we reused components as much as possible in front development, efficiently configured the UI, and simplified code and file to increase readability. When it comes to backend development, we made efforts to provide stable service by building MSA-structured server on EC2 which separated server by function. In addition, RESTful API was developed with MVC structure for future maintenance, and we improved the convenience of project distribution by automating distribution with Jenkins. In addition, we were able to learn the process of collaborating while working on multiple team projects. Through Git, we were able to learn version management of code, communication between front end and backend through Swagger, share progress with team members through Jira, and learn how to implement Agile-applied project. The team leader also recognized my hard work and sincerity and received an incentive that was unprecedented. Through this experience, I am responsible for my work, do my best, and have an active attitude. "Talent who keeps running" If I were to describe myself in one word, I would consider myself a "marathon." This is because, over the past year and a half, I have built up my web development capabilities with two training sessions and three web projects, and I will continue to build up my capabilities. As a graduation project during my undergraduate years, I developed a sign language translator using Java, and I became attracted to object-oriented programming, and while looking for Java-based development methodology, I became interested in web development. Therefore, I participated in the 300-hour 'JAVA Framework Practical Developer Training Course' to lay the foundation for web development. However, I had difficulty in understanding the web and developing high-quality projects for 300 hours. As a result, I was able to challenge 'OOOOOOOOOOOOOOOO' to make up for my lack of competency, and I had a great opportunity to receive a year of web development training. For six months, I developed my web development capabilities by learning both the front and back ends using Spring and value.js. After receiving the training, we conducted a recipe recommendation project that considers the user's preference by using a travel record platform project based on user location information and big data, and we were able to present outstanding prizes at both project presentations. Through this project, we were able to develop our full stack development capabilities by participating in both the backend and the frontend. When it comes to front-end development, we reused components as much as possible, efficiently configured the UI, and simplified code and file to increase readability. When it comes to back-end development, we built a service with MSA structure that separated servers by function on AWS to build a stable service, developed an efficient RESTful API with MVC structure, and improved the convenience of project distribution by automating distribution with Jenkins. As I have been working hard on one path, I am confident that I am a talented person who will continue to develop and develop from now on.""3rd Excellence Award"3rd Project"I gained web development capability by experiencing 3 projects in OO"OOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOO. We worked on 3 projects to build a cloud-based web using EC2 and built a server mainly in charge of the backend. I will introduce two of them. First, the project called Commitment is a travel history web service that was born with the idea from Github's lawn planting. Taking charge of the backend, we built a DB using Mariadb and produced various RESTful APIs using SpringBoot. First, we needed the user's location permission to record the trip. However, we realized that location permission was only available in the https environment, and we newly learned that https was required to support security and various services. Therefore, we received SSL certificates and distributed them at https, contributing to the smooth progress of the project. In addition, we were able to grow the most by challenging various technologies such as firebase and S3, and we had the ability to learn and apply new things with the mind of developing developers. Second, Recook was a personalized recipe recommendation service that analyzed users' tastes using big data. His role was to implement recipe recommendation API based on content-based filtering using recipe crawling using python and Django. However, due to the large amount of data, there was a problem that it took about 10 seconds to execute the recommended algorithm. Therefore, we divided the table to optimize the query's performance, and we were able to reduce the time from 10 seconds to 3 seconds. Although the time was shortened, it was regrettable that more time would have been saved if semi-normalization was performed or redis was applied to reduce repetitive join in the initial DB design. As such, I have built up the ability to think about the performance of better projects and to create optimal efficiency.""CS Study" I think the most lacking competency at the moment is CS knowledge. I have built up some JAVA programming ability and capability in algorithms through continuous algorithm studies for a year, but I felt that I lacked knowledge of really basic CS. Therefore, a study was formed to gain CS basic knowledge, and the study was conducted every day and a topic of the field each other wanted was selected and presented. The presentation materials were organized in the Notion and organized by subject so that the study members could see it easily. There was a huge difference between knowing the acquired knowledge to yourself and explaining it to others. In order to explain to others, I had to understand the deep content, and when a question came in to the study members, I had to study even matters related to the subject to answer it. Therefore, I was able to make the knowledge gained through the presentation more mine. Even after doing the study, I have time to review every day to familiarize myself with the presentation of other team members, and I am trying to understand exactly what I presented. I will continue to do CS studies and build basic competencies for development. "'Actual Service' I have worked on three web projects, but I think I still lack web development capabilities. We also used Redis to align our data to scale out our servers in the future. We will continue to maintain, build practical capabilities, and build problem response capabilities."

In the programming language/A0/1st grade, I took the C language class for the first time and proceeded with a project to create a game. It was difficult to create a game, but the sense of accomplishment gained by completing the functions one by one made me interested in programming. Object-oriented language/B0/When I took the class, I didn't fully understand the C language, so I felt unfamiliar with object-oriented language. However, as I developed a sign language translator using Java as a graduation project in the fourth grade, I became attracted to object-oriented programming, and while looking for a Java-based development methodology, I became interested in web development. It was a class that allowed me to understand the concepts of database/A0/object, relationship, and attribute. Based on the understood concepts, I was able to understand one-to-one, many-to-many, and many-to-many relationships between objects and learn how to draw ERD. In addition, I was able to CRUD DB data using SQL, understand INNER JOIN, LEFT/RIGHT OUTER JOIN, and write Query. I was able to learn about the design and implementation methods of various data structures for data structures/B+/array stack queue trees and graphs. It was a class that could have a solid foundation by learning examples of algorithms to see what kind of situations these data structures could be applied to. Algorithm Analysis/A+/ Through the class, I was able to understand algorithmic notation, alignment, search, and graphs. I learned how to select an efficient algorithm to solve problems according to situations using various data structures. I have experience in creating a recipe recommendation platform based on user taste using big data "Shortening from 10 seconds to 3 seconds". I was in charge of implementing the function to recommend related recipes using content-based filtering in Django. Using Python, we imported more than 5,000 recipe data through crawling and processed more than 70,000 review data. We succeeded in implementing the function of recommending recipes with similar ingredients using content-based filtering, but a problem occurred. It took about 10 seconds to receive the data, and it was inconvenient to use the service. To determine the cause, we ran the code line by line and conducted the test. As a result, the reason why it took a long time to receive the data was in query. When there were 70,000 review data, it was the main cause of the performance degradation, and when five tables were joined at once, query's performance dropped sharply. Therefore, the review table and the recipe-hashtag-material-material-material name four tables were joined and imported separately, and only the columns were required. The API, which took 10 seconds to receive the data, was reduced to 3 seconds. Although the time was shortened, it was regrettable that if semi-normalization had been performed to reduce repetitive join in the initial DB design, it would have saved a little more time. As a result, the project was successfully completed, and I realized the importance of meticulous design even if it took time. "Why we need to distinguish between the entity and the DTO," I have experience in contributing to the award of excellence at the SSAFY Common Project Competition by developing the backend of the travel platform production project with constant challenge spirit and persistence. I was in charge of the backend based on SpringBoot, and I decided to apply JPA that I had never learned before. Of course, I was used to using MyBatis, but JPA is known to be excellent in performance, productivity, and maintenance, so I tried to learn a new technology by applying JPA. However, I was not familiar with JPA, so there was a problem during development. After mapping different tables to the entity, an error occurred after going around an infinite loop. In addition, in the response, unnecessary data was provided, resulting in an increase in the amount of response data. I belatedly learned that this problem is caused by not generating the entity and the DTO separately. I realized that DTO is a class for View used by Request/Response, and since it needs to be changed frequently, it is appropriate to create it separately. To solve this problem, I created DTO separately and used the BeanUtils.copyProperties method to convert it from entity to DTO. It took a long time to modify everything, but I realized the necessity of DTO and that DTO served as a designer. Thanks to the spirit of challenge to acquire new skills and persistence to solve problems, I was able to successfully complete the project and win the Excellence Award.",,,,
